9$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$1/20/2019 1:29:35 AM$Reviewer: Retired old crazy cat lady, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I suffer from osteoarthritis and major depressive disorder.  After 11years on paxil, and having read the possible benefit of pain reduction, I asked doctor about changing.  I stepped down from Paxil, while starting duloxetine on small dose then increasing as Paxil was phased out.  It's like night and day!  My depression is no longer controlling my life!  I don't think there is any difference in pain control, but I hate to think how bad it would be without it.  I believe my body had become immune to or adjusted to the Paxil so much that it was no longer effective. Other than some sweating at night, I have no side effects.  I am a content person now and no longer dread social situations.

column1: 13$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$12/15/2018 8:29:01 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$1$5$"This is honestly the worst drug anyone could ever take. I took 60mg of Duloxetine for over 5 years and had to come off it for surgery.
I was initially prescribed it by a psychiatrist and left on it for so long because my GPs didn’t know what it was or what it did. Admittedly
column2: it did the job and helped a lot with my depression and anxiety
column3: but it wasn’t worth it for the withdrawal symptoms I suffered with.

column1: Do not take this drug long term - you will never be able to come off it. The withdrawal is absolutely horrendous. I actually thought I was having a seizure at one point. I had absolutely no choice but to come off it because it isn’t available in liquid form. If I wasn’t having surgery
column2: I’d have taken it again in an instant to stop the awful withdrawal effects.

column1: I have been reading lots about this drug and feel I have to warn people. There have been many lawsuits against the manufacturer because coming off it is likened to coming off speed. The withdrawal can last years for some people.

I can’t even describe how awful it is trying to come off this drug. I honestly thought I was going to die. I had flashes of electricity through my brain every couple of minutes that rendered me totally unable to do anything. My head was fuzzy
column2: I had awful dreams and sweats
column3: I had stomach upsets and just a terrible feeling of paranoia.

column1: I have been off it for six months now and I was lucky that the withdrawal effects stopped after around 2 months.
Please
column2: please
column3: please be aware before taking this drug - stopping it was one of the hardest things I’ve ever done in my life. I wish I’d known about it before I started taking it. "

I slipped and fell 9 months ago and  been dealing with a herniated disc, multiple annular tears, and a pats defect fracture everyday since. IÃ¢Â?Â?ve never been depressed in my life until about 6 months ago when I realized how long the recovery would be and how much ithe one fall turned my entire life upside down. I was crying daily (sometimes multiple times) and started havingsevere and uncontrollable anxiety everyday. I was also in chronic pain all through my spine and right side of my body. 34$Condition: Repeated Episodes of Anxiety$7/13/2017 4:29:14 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Cymbalta has made the difference in my life. I had serious
column2: awful anxiety that felt completely out of my control. I did therapy for 6 months with no change before being sent to a psychiatrist. The first few days were hard as I felt irritable for seemingly no reason. About the first week in I felt like ""not myself"" although I couldn't explain past that. I just felt... weird. 2 weeks in I realized I didn't feel like myself because I wasn't anxious and my mind was finally free to think about other things. It's been a year later and my anxiety is still very low. Rarely
column3: I have times where I feel anxious still but it's nothing like it was before: hours and hours each day thinking anxious thoughts that I couldn't stop
column4: countless times crying over nothing
column5: asking my family for reassurance daily
column6: etc. No more. I feel like a completely different person now. "

45$Condition: Anxiousness associated with Depression$6/27/2016 12:17:03 PM$Reviewer: Polly63, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$5$After trying Paxil and Effexor for chronic depression, a psychiatrist changed my diagnosis to major depressive disorder with anxiety.  She prescribed Duloxetine which I have taken for at least 8 years.  It has been the most effective medication to date. With the help of a clinical psychologist there are only 2 months per year that I consider low periods.  I will revisit my therapist before those months. I have been in and out of psychological therapy and psychiatric care for 20 years.  I would like to tell others to not give up or be satisfied with minimal quality of life. I worked with 3 other psychologists before I worked with my current one.  Only one of those psychologists was not a good match. The other two had to give up practicing for health reasons.  We moved to another city, but I am close enough to see the therapist I have worked with for about 10 years. I only see her when I need a fine tuning. I am currently looking for a new psychiatrist in the city where we live because my previous doctor retired.

58$Condition: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender & Painful Muscles$6/26/2015 11:36:38 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$4$I am a late-30s female who was put on 30mg generic duloxetine during a hospital stay for disabling pain (along with anxiety/depression). A follow-up with a rheumatologist quickly resulted in a fibromyalgia diagnosis and increase to 60mg duloxetine (also meloxicam for pain
column2: tramadol for sleep
column3: and klonopin for anxiety). I slowly improved with physical therapy in addition to the meds. After about 5 months I had weaned off the Rx meds except for duloxetine (60mg daily) and meloxicam (as-needed). At this point I am experiencing some troublesome side effects from the duloxetine - mainly increased insomnia (lorazepam a couple times a week helps) and severe episodes of constipation. Also
column4: changes in hair growth and difficulty w/ orgasm. I will be slowly reducing (but not stopping) my dosage to try to reduce side effects while maintaining the gains I've made. The plan is to reduce to 50mg
column5: then 40mg and even 30mg if necessary.

column1: BOTTOM LINE: While this is not a miracle drug for fibromyalgia
column2: it has certainly played a part in my recovery. Benefits vs. side effects should be closely monitored by the individual (in concert with advice from their docs) to achieve an optimal balance that the individual can live with. Best wishes to all of you dealing with these difficult issues."

column16: (weights
column17: stretching
column18: swimming indoors
column19: walking)throughout my life. To be struck by this weird disease and to look the picture of health has had me baffled. The worst now is the relentless fatigue I feel daily. I begin my day thinking I can do as much as I have always and in a very short while I am over come w/fatigue and must sit or lie down before tackeling another house hold project. I have not worked for months or driven my car (six speed standard) for fear of not being able to depress the clutch! I believe I am improving but I also have noticed that a low pressure weather system with rain will affect my pain level quite a bit. I believe the Cymbalta was the key that started me on the path to finding which medications would help me. I am loathed to think how long I must be on these medications since all are very expensive

column1: 132$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$6/10/2008 9:18:13 AM$Reviewer: Jenni
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month$1$1$1$"After approx. 1 wk on Cymbalta
column3: major episode of rt. hand swelling twice the size
column4: fingers w/ no feeling
column5: brown/red/blue ""leather-looking"" skin with a large
column6: pulsating lump that appeared in the center of the hand
column7: stretching the skin as it grew before my eyes within 10 minutes! A very dangerous drug with 35+ side effects that people don't know about unless they search to find real-life experiences & studies done not only in the U.S.
column8: but other countries. This lasted 2-1/2 wks; there are reported experiences of swelling of the THROAT in which you must get medical attention immediately--I was ""lucky"" & immediately stopped using. People should always research (on sites other than the drug's site) all possible side effects & consider asking for something far less invasive. My hand literally looked like a monkey's paw & was Not Usable for weeks. I still do not see this particular reporting in the advertisement literature--just ""swelling."" That is an understatement. Be your own best advocate so you will lower the incidence of some of these frightening results. Many of the anti-depressant drugs/anxiety stay in your system even after you stop. Take time to read what other people have experienced & less on ""a few people experienced..."" in ads. I had no prior history of anything of this nature
column9: so it can happen to anyone. There are many excellent drugs (older drugs) that work much better under supervision. Thank you."

183$Condition: Anxiousness associated with Depression$5/6/2018 8:57:42 PM$Reviewer: AvoidCymbaltaUnlessFinalDesperation, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$1$I was desparate for anything to help my MDD and Anxiety that resulted from an abusive 15 year marriage and took Cymbalta for about 2 months. It wasnâ??t making any difference and then I experienced the formerly unknown horror of brain zaps. At times I felt like I was floating just off the mattress! Iâ??ve always been physically healthy so this was far worse and scarier than any mental â??challengeâ? I was having. Then I tried to quit. Nightmare thatâ??s a blur now of several days, little sleep, and feelings I can only describe as messed up. Thankfully, I found someoneâ??s review online that described how to ween off of it successfully. Each dose, you remove 3 more beads than previously removed from the capsule. It worked and Iâ??ll never view Rx drugs the same. Unless youâ??re facing the alternative of a life of hell without any other hope, stay away from Cymbalta, is my strong advice. If you take it, understand that it will own you and new problems you never imagined when become your norm. Can you tell I feel lucky to have found a way off? By the way, turned out I had developed Complex PTSD from my experiences and was ultimately helped only by EMDR after 7 years of seeking help from expensive psychiatrists and psychologists with no noticeable change. Highly recommend it though totally surprised it actually worked. I have a functional life now, off of Social Security Disability finally, and working full time for a year now with bonuses from my performance after being unable to hold a job for the first time in my life over 9 years.prior to now. Really want to be able to help others who are where I was.

column1: 211$Condition: Anxiousness associated with Depression$11/3/2017 1:59:18 PM$Reviewer: Cymbalta issue
column2: 45-54 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$1$I began Cymbalta and approx. 4 weeks in I began having diarrhea.  I thought it was a virus and waited 10 days and then went to my doctor.  I discussed with her the only change that I had was the Cymbalta.  She didn't think that it was the cause and so I remained on the drug.  2 weeks later I still had the diarrhea so I was referred to a gastroenterologist.  They did a colonoscopy and said it initially looked healthy.  A week or so later they called me and told me that I had Lymphocytic Colitis.  One of the first things she said to me was that she noticed I was on Cymbalta.  I told her say nothing more because I was already in the middle of weaning myself off because I felt like it had to be the issue.  She said yes they have found that it can cause this. So you think ok problem solved
column3: but Lymphocytic Colitis cannot be cured.  I am now under control but only because I take Budesonide 3mg daily.  It was a miserable existence without it
column4: and don't say why don't you try gluten free
column5: or no dairy... I have tried it all.  My 2nd opinion Gastroenterologist said
column6: our patients with this have also tried everything
column7: just take the pill. Why in an otherwise healthy person
column8: exercise regularly eat healthy would it do this... I don't know but I am obviously not the only one!

column1: well
column2: I'm having mostly good things to say about this medication so far. I was weaned from venlafaxine/effexor to duloxetine/cymbalta because after taking the venlafaxine for over 10 years with no complaints except the withdraws from missing or forgetting a single dose
column3: I developed high blood pressure. So duloxetine was the obvious choice. During the weaning process there were no issues and I sailed through it
column4: and noticed  help with some of the back pains immediately
column5: however as soon as I dropped taking any effexor I because forgetful and extremely sleepy on a daily basis. It has been about a month on just the duloxetine and the symptoms are getting less severe but are still an issue.

column1: There was one other thing I noticed since being on the duloxetine alone
column2: I was slowly brought up to 60 mg twice daily and I have now forgotten my morning dose three times. Each time I was wildly emotional and crying intensely
column3: the first two times I thought it might have been my issues I'm currently dealing with
column4: however once again today I missed my dose not realizing until I take the evening dose
column5: and I was insanely emotional and crying repeatedly today. I did some checking into this on the internet and this seems to be a somewhat common issue/reaction related to missing a single dose.  Then I noticed today as well high blood pressure can also be a side effect
column6: so not really sure which medication I would prefer at this point. the venlafaxine never made me tired
column7: it actually amped me just a small amount
column8: and with all my issues you can guess motivation is a big problem for me. However
column9: I'm getting some added pain relief from the duloxetine
column10: but very sleepy still. guess time will tell..."

column1: I was also prescribed Cymbalta a decade ago during a major depressive episode requiring inpatient hospitalization. The results were remarkable. In a span of 24 hours
column2: I had much greater mood regulation and was not ruminating on negative thoughts. Cymbalta was also helpful in developing healthy eating patterns after a period of binge eating. The appetite suppressing effect made it easier for me to modify portions and lose the weight I'd gained. I took Cymbalta for two years with minimal side effects. I have been dealing with depression/anxiety for years and I also suffer from migraines. Cymbalta helps with pain also. I cannot emphasize enough that what works for me or others, will work for you. The only way you'll know is if you try. Don't be scared by all the negativity you read by others. Also, when I was on Cymbalta the first time, I was never hungry and I LOST weight... others have said they gained weight which I thought was strange because even my doctor told me one of the side effects was decreased appetite. Whatever you decide to do, I wish you peace, luck and happiness.

323$Condition: Anxiousness associated with Depression$6/3/2015 9:08:12 PM$Reviewer: Sheldonoff, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I am not a doctor.  I am a sick old man. I have been taking Cymbalta 30 mg for several years as a component of my daily medication cocktail. It is virtually impossible to determine or rate the effectiveness of a drug like this when you are taking eight to ten (or more) other medications which deal with contiguous medical conditions.  The side effects of every drug cross the side effects of another drug being prescribed to a patient by a different doctor for a different medical condition.  Sounds confusing and it is.  However, with respect to Cymbalta, I will say this.  When I first began taking the drug, I noticed a definite improvement in my pertinent symptoms.  I have been taking it for several years now at a low dosage and I have continued to notice its effectiveness with no negative side effects.  In short, it has continued to work for me, and in this sense I endorse it.  However, I consider myself lucky because medications such as Cymbalta are prescribed by many doctors who are not sufficiently checking the side effects of parenthetic drugs which his or her patients take. This is particularly the case when some of those medications in a patient's chart have been prescribed by other doctors for other medical conditions.  I suspect that even routine  pharmacology  can be a very dangerous crap game when it is played by too many doctors who have forgotten some of the basic clinical skills they learned in med school.    
324$Condition: Chronic Muscle or Bone Pain$6/1/2015 8:35:30 AM$Reviewer: Abuela2340, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$4$I took Cymbalta for fibromyalgia, arthritis and diabetic nerve pain. This medication caused severe nausea and depression. When I began this medication I was so nauseous that I could not get out of bed. The nausea did not improve as my physician suggested it would. After several days I was still unable to function, in pain and awoke with severe depression. I have a Bipolar disorder and take a low dose of Lamotrigine to stabilize my moods and this drug made it ineffective and worse. When I stopped taking the Cymbalta I experienced such severe muscular pain that even after the nausea subsided I was unable to get out of bed for two and a half weeks. This drug seems to be dangerous for people with depression and or bipolar disorder. It made me pretty upset that my physician did not take my other conditions into consideration and ignored my concerns and reaction to this drug.

The pain was bearable with this medication. Unfortunately, even though the literature says weight loss is a side effect, I gained 40 pounds the first year despite being much more active and my diet was the same. I tried quitting cold turkey and that was a nightmare so I went back on it. I am now fed up with the extra 50 pounds...weaning off over a period of two months. I now have kidney, liver, adrenal problems that were not evident before taking the drug. I chose this drug much too quickly, trusting the literature, and now I wish I'd never tried it. If you don't mind the weight change, it could be amazing for fibromyalgia sufferers....just never go off cold turkey!

354$Condition: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender & Painful Muscles$1/30/2015 11:22:43 PM$Reviewer: Dana1972, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I have fibro, and my doctor started me on Cymbalta 30 MG and I started out being nauseous and I was sweating constantly, that lasted about a week. My fibro seemed better but the second week I started hurting again so my doctor increased my dosage to 60 mg. It has been a life saver for me. Last month I had to purchase the generic version because my money was low, needless to say I will never go back to the generic cymbalta. It Did Not Work for me at all..... It gave me headaches everyday, and not normal headaches, I had what felt like pressure in my head. Like I had a rubber band wrapped around my head. I know that Cymbalta is expensive but it is honestly worth it. I am a completely different person when I take it. I can actually move and get out and do things. I'm 42 years old and Fibro had me down before, but not now. The only downside to Cymbalta is the price but I will do without something else every month so that I can get this medicine. I wish that they would lower the price of it because it's hard to pay for it every month when you don't have insurance.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $3$1$3$this drug helped my depression at the expense of my emotional capacity. no empathy
column3: poor judgement and heavy drinking. Physical impact included high blood pressure
column4: heavy weight gain leading to high cholesterol
column5: and the inability to empty my bladder leading to chronic UIT's. I did a gradual taper under my psychiatrist's guidance and went through a devastating withdrawal from which i still have not recovered over 5 months later. developed serious symptoms I never had previous to taking cymbalta including disabling anxiety.   do not let anyone tell you it is the depression coming back. this happens to people who took it for pain and had no history of depression. the black box warning mentions risk of suicidal thoughts. it happens when increasing and decreasing your dose. do not let a doctor tell you that you need anti-depressants for life. get good cognitive behavioral therapy. research shows it works better than drugs and i am living proof. now that i quit
column6: i am active
column7: lost weight
column8: now my bmi is 20. no more High BP and cholesterol is 95.

column1: 388$Condition: Neuropathic Pain$10/13/2014 1:45:56 PM$Reviewer: HappilyPainFree
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have MS and was recently diagnosed with Fibromyalgia. I was treated with IV steroids for a scary episode where I was partially blind in one eye. The steroids worked wonders on my pain and fortunately
column3: there was nothing wrong with my eyesight. However
column4: the drug lowered my immunity. I caught the flu & developed bronchitis and it took 6 weeks to get better. While I was recovering I lost my job. All of this together quickly spiraled me into a deep
column5: painful
column6: depression. I found myself weeping for no reason at all and sleeping as often as I could. My digestive system was a mess. I couldn't eat normally. I felt helpless
column7: I felt out of control. I hurt everywhere.

column1: CYMBALTA saved my life. It removed the overall pain and greatly improved my mood and energy. If you use this
column2: remember to take the drug at the same time daily. Missing a dose or being casual with your dosage is bad. You might experience insomnia for the first month as your brain gets used to the new levels of chemical interactions. This is normal. Inability to climax while sexually stimulated is also normal. Eventually (3 months for me) it all normalized. The relief from constant pain and sadness is worth the initial side effects and need to take the drug consistently for me. Don't give up quickly and whatever you do
column3: don't wean yourself off without help. (I tried Effexor years ago and the half-life is shorter than Cymbalta which made dosage timing even more critical. These are powerful drugs which work wonders if you use them correctly.)"

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $1$1$3$"My Rheumatologist put me on 60 mg of Cymbalta for SLE and inflammatory arthritis in April 2014.  After almost 7 months of being on Cymbalta I had an episode with my Lupus.  My rheumatologist then did new blood work and found that my liver was failing!!  He had not performed any blood tests since March 2014 prior to putting me on Cymbalta.  He then told me to stop taking Cymbalta and gave me a 7 day 30 mg taper.  It didn't work!  I was having suicidal thoughts
column3: brain ""zaps""
column4: fatigue
column5: vomiting and the list goes on and on of withdrawal symptoms.   At times I felt like I was dying!  Do not take this medication no matter what any doc says.  I am 45 years old and have never felt WORSE in my whole life. ... The pain is NOTHING compared to the withdrawal you will feel coming off of this medication.  My advice is to never get on it in the first place!!  Getting off of Cymbalta has made me feel like I want to die...I had no choice but to get back on the medication and try to taper myself off.  This medication is awful.  Trust me don't ever begin to take it.    "

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$4$I started on low dose (30mg). The first couple weeks was horrible for me. Nausea
column4: dizzy spells
column5: heart palpitations
column6: etc. All gradually began to get better and my doctor upped my dose to 60mg. Side effects not so bad now AND I'm beginning to feel better which is encouraging. Right now I am taking 30mg twice a day - 2pm and 8pm. It has been a challenge to remember to take the medicine at those strange times. When I took my dosage at 8am
column7: by 2pm I was in a 'fog' and had a terrible time focusing on anything (which was probably more from my condition than form the medication). We moved the dose to later in the day and I have found the 'foggy' episodes are less severe. This is tramendous for me and my work schedule. I have to admit I fought taking this medicine hard. After my first month I had a list of reasons why I felt the medicine was making me sick. My doctor gently explained away all my worries and showed me it was my disease making me sick. That was a blow because so bad I wanted it to be the medicine making me sick and not my diease. That way
column8: in my mind I could stop taking the medicine and I would feel better. He backed up his explanation with an offer to wean me off the medicine and see how I felt for a couple of weeks. He was right! As bad as I thought the medicine was making me feel
column9: I felt 10 times worse without it. I don't know why it is so hard to remember that.

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $2$1$2$"I was feeling depressed after having back surgery 5 months ago and having alot of pain from just being diagnosed with undifferentiated mixed connective tissue disease.  I am 51 and had pain in my wrist; upper and lower back; shoulder;knees.  So my rheumatologist put me on 30mg Cymbalta and told me to give it a few weeks to work. It was a very bad experience for me (I had taken other antidepressants in the past and never had a problem with any of them.)  I hadn't been on one for about a year and was doing fine until all the aches and pains brought me down. (I am tall and thin and before back surgery was very active.)  The Cymbalta worked for the back pain
column4: but when I first started taking it I couldn't sleep at all the first week
column5: then the 2nd week I slept 24 hours straight one day and got very depressed crying and listless and lost the will to live.  I quit taking it and immediately started feeling better. Since I was on a very low dose of Cymbalta and have taken Lexipro and Prozac successfully in the past
column6: I think Cymbalta is a much heavier drug than I am willing to take.  It is an SNRI as opposed to an SSRI and I've come to the conclusion that my norepinephrine level should not be messed with. I know some people might think ""she should have given it more than 2 1/2 weeks to work.""  To those people I say- any drug that can change your brain that much in such a short period of time is way more powerful and scary than anything I've ever been on.  My nephew had the same experience on it.  I'm glad I am off of it and would much rather have the pain than be a zombie."

column2: 55-64 Male  (Patient) $5$5$5$60 year old male. Since childhood have always had anxiety problems. Because of this

It does have in my case strong sexual side effects including lack of interest and performance
column4: but other than that
column5: I think it is a wonderful drug. I tried going off Cymbalta twice. I could not succeed. So my feeling is I will probably be on it forever unless something better comes along. I feel the generic is a bit weaker than brand
column6: but at the 90 mg
column7: it is fine. Good luck!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $1$1$5$At first the Cymbalta worked wonders. My pain was gone and I felt amazing. Never felt like a human before. Being free of pain naturally made me happy and my mood improved greatly. Within 4 months however

I began to experience vertigo several times a week that was so bad I had to curl into a ball and squeeze my eyes shut to try to stop the spinning sensation. I became hyper sensitive to smells and developed allergy sensitivities to the smallest things
column4: often with hives. I gained weight. Constant dry mouth and stomach pain. My insurance kept fighting my doctor refusing to pay for it each month so I'd go through terrible withdrawal while they sorted it out for days between refills. I eventually weaned myself off of it over the course of 3 weeks. Experienced horrible mood swings
column5: crying bursts
column6: intense rage
column7: anxiety attacks
column8: and more migraines. This was the first time I had ever taken a prescription drug for anything and now I'm terrified to even try anything else. column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I don't normally write reviews

I was prescribed 60 mg. of Cymbalta for mild depression and fibromyalgia. I have been on it for one month and I have much less pain from the fibromyalgia PLUS it seems to be helping with my migraines and IBS.  I haven't gained any weight
column5: don't have any more trouble than usual sleeping and not tired from the drug. In fact

column7: but my doctor said I may need to try different ones to see which one gave me less side effects.  I am happy with Cymbalta.

column1: 625$Condition: Chronic Muscle or Bone Pain$10/29/2013 4:49:53 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$1$5$"I took cymbalta....90 mil 2x daily for 9 years. In March of 2013 I took my last pill.  I had been taking other meds for depression when I was in need of pain management the doc said this drug was the ONE.....I was totally pleased ...well until I stopped them....withdrawal was horrible!!  It's been 9 months since I stopped..the depression is now gone..anxiety gone...I actually feel better than I did years and years ago...more so than that the drug turned me into a person even I couldn't stand...I had NO IDEA ....nor did I know the battle I was in for when I stopped the drug. Withdrawal from cymbalta is compared to heroin....I was told the only thing I could was to start taking it again....never will I take this drug again.  Worse is I saw 3 different docs ....No one ever suggested my symptoms were a Side effect of cymbalta...just more pills to try to deal with all of them...but when I stopped the benzos I truly thought I was going to die...panic attacks really really bad....I had no clue they were controlling most all of these side effects....I would have thought the doc would have known but just kept giving me cymbalta which I kept taking..SCARY good luck if this is the road you take...after 9 months of NO meditation I continue to have severe ""brain zaps"" and the ringing buzzing & pounding in my ears is non stop...I continue to hope this too will pass."

687$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$9/6/2013 10:43:02 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$5$5$I have been on Cymbalta at 60mg for 3 months and so far I think it's wonderful. Before this I was on Pristique and I would have episodes of uncontrollable crying and anxiety. I weaned off it for about 3 weeks before getting on Cymbalta and that was an awful thing to go through. Cymbalta helped me right away. Cymbalta has helped me feel more like myself and I can go on with my normal daily activities. Pristique and other anti-depressants have made me feel foggy. Cymbalta does not do this to me. I've had trouble sleeping with other medicines and with cymbalata I occasionally wake up in the middle of the night to go to the bathroom but then fall right back asleep. I'm not so sure if that is a direct relation to the medication or not. I also have bad gas occasionally (not uncontrollable, just stinky) but i'm not sure if it is a side affect and if it is it is very minor compared to the benefits. I haven't experienced any weight gain/loss and I follow a healthy diet. Cymbalta is working for me but won't work for everyone. Pristique was horrible for me but is great for others. Depression is caused by a chemical imbalance in the brain (in most cases) and everyone is different. So I encourage you to try it and keep trying until you find the right one.

The bad: Cymbalta minor side effects going away once you get used to it and the other harsh side effects will start as long as you on cymbalta and last 3 months after first day withdrew cymbalta. Cymbalta make you become suicidal if you have a lots of friends you going lose most of them if you are married your marriage will fall apart if you are a professional you going to loss your profession if you're family lover you going lose it,basically you lose one by one as you go on with cymbalta. When you read all the reviews people say good things and bad things about cymbalta but you experience all of it slowly one by one. Cymbalta does effects the liver the most if you're alcohol drinker stop you going lose your liver,don't take any herbal supplement it will cause liver damage if you have liver disease tell your doctor and ask your doctor give you liver function test every 3 months even you're healthy person with no liver problem. The bottom line is your choice between your health conditions and Cymbalta personally I don't recommend to anyone. 702$Condition: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender & Painful Muscles$8/21/2013 12:03:28 PM$Reviewer: dogmomma, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $3$1$3$Warning possible severe eye problem!  I eventually did my own research on the web and discontinued this drug. It caused mydriasis - dilation of the pupils which makes eyes unable to focus.  It has some nasty withdrawal symptoms but after two months my eyes are back to my usual vision.  This was prescibed for fibromyalgia along with another antidepressant and other drugs.  I started having problems with my vision.  I could not focus in the midrange
column2: like the shelf on a grocery store.  I saw my optometrist
column3: got new glasses
column4: they didn't help
column5: got another pair and then another.  I saw an ophthalmologist who said my eyes were too dilated and prescribed pilocarpine drops
column6: which were a nightmare
column7: making my vision better for an hour or two at a time and worse the rest of the time
column8: plus they caused headache and total night blindness. I asked the prescribing psychiatrist who could only tell me that ""blurred vision"" was listed as a side offect of cymbalta but also of several other meds I was taking.  I asked the ophthalmologist if my problem could be a side effect of one one my meds and he said no.  I did more research once I had a name for the problem - mydriasis - and found that it is a rare but noted side effect of cymbalta.  Unlike the people in the study the mydriasis got better after a couple of months off this medication.  Yes
column9: my body hurts more without cymbalta and I have to take more of another antidepressant but I am so much better off without it.  Wish there had been more info available to me so here is my contribution."

column6: Deplin and Lovaza.  I am still here

column1: 728$Condition: Disorder characterized by Stiff
column2: Tender & Painful Muscles$7/30/2013 12:36:28 AM$Reviewer: BEST way to wean off!
column3: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$1$3$"I was put on Cymbalta for Fibromyalgia and it worked wonderfully for the pain and exhaustion I'd faced for years. Unfortunately
column4: it also made me extremely suicidal and I ended up hospitalized for a week in the psych ward!! My doctor tried to off-set those side effects by adding Lamictal (guessing it might work like it does for bipolar)
column5: but it didn't help much. Cymbalta is quite nasty to stop using but after researching online
column6: I was able to find a weaning method that worked MUCH better than my doctor's initial suggestions. I dropped from 80 to 40mg
column7: then started opening the capsules and removing beads (there are about 180-200 in there). At the beginning
column8: I went down pretty quickly by removing ten pellets at a time and holding steady for a couple days at each level. So for example I'd take capsules with 170 pellets for five days
column9: then take capsules with 160 pellets for five days
column10: and so on. I had to reduce much slower as I was getting closer to zero pellets. I had to start reducing by single pellets when I was around 40ish (I think) because I was noticing the brain fog & zaps when I was reducing by 2 then.

column1: It took me almost a complete year to taper off completely this way
column2: but I had almost no withdrawal symptoms! I've been med free for over a month and I haven't had any rebounds or residual effects. I strong encourage this method of weaning!"

I have episodes of sweating and lightheadedness but Cymbalta has helped me so much I consider these minor inconveniences.

785$Condition: Repeated Episodes of Anxiety$6/8/2013 10:15:01 PM$Reviewer: Jon, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$4$I have a history of depression, for which my psychiatrist has prescribed taking an antidepressant on a more or less permanent basis.  But my real reason for wanting to take Cymbalta is to prevent anxiety.  I think it's the best one I've taken.  I don't get any generalized/concurrent nervousness/anxiety with it, and I don't get any moments of panic either.  I just feel comfortable most of the time.  The downside I have with the drug concerns my sleeping.  If I slept well the night before, I get severe insomnia the next night and just want to stay up and enjoy activities all night.  So I am taking Trazodone for sleep at night, which helps.  But the Cymbalta also causes sleepiness during the day regardless of whether I did or didn't sleep well the night before and regardless of whether I took the Trazodone (it's definitely the Cymbalta causing it.)  So for that, I drink a lot of caffeinated drinks like tea during the day.  Thankfully, the caffeine doesn't negate the antianxiety effects of the Cymbalta for me.  I admit I don't have my sleep perfectly worked out, but with Cymbalta I don't feel worried or apprehensive about anything.

column1: 807$Condition: Chronic Muscle or Bone Pain$5/21/2013 8:14:28 PM$Reviewer: Amymoon
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $1$1$3$"I was put on cymbalta for fibromyalgia. My pain has been chronic and worsening for the past three years I have been on cymbalta. My vision has deteriorated
column3: I was exhausted
column4: no interest in sex
column5: headaches
column6: dizzy
column7: I could go on and on. Finally with no energy or concentration- I started weaning myself off with my dr.'s ok I have been counting beads since last July. I got to 40 beads of 260 in the 30 mg (started on 60 mg). Learned the hard way that half the beads in both sizes are sugar pill filler which explained why every day was a crap shoot as to how bad withdrawal symptoms would be each day. So my gp asked how badly I wanted off (badly) and prescribed Paxil to ease side effects. To my great joy I have been off cymbalta for four days- I get to wean off the Paxil in a few more days and will be clear of them all. My pain is lessened  I have still got headaches but thank god no zaps (those hurt). I'm still pretty exhausted but I have also had a lot of stress.

column1: If it is a suggestion you start taking this- do some research. Look into "" withdrawal of cymbalta"" there are so many support groups of people trying to get off this that FDA has started looking at Eli Lilly - it may be effective for some but it sure as hell wasn't for me. Approach with incredible caution.  My pain is so much better than it was that I feel like Lilly has stolen three years of my life"

855$Condition: Chronic Muscle or Bone Pain$3/16/2013 5:06:09 PM$Reviewer: jnfr, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$2$5$I was on Cymbalt for 6 years.  It helped with my Fibromyalgia pain and my depression though my mood was almost too even keeled on it.  I had a friend who said I was like a zombie on it.  Also, drinking alchol while taking Cymbalta is a very bad idea, not even a little bit of alchohol, no matter the proof.  The main reason I stopped taking it was because of the skin rash/lesions it caused which wasn't a well-known side-effect when I first started taking it.  Even when I finally did figure out the Cymbalta was causing my skin problems the doctors had a hard time believing me.  I had skin lesions that didn't heal for years and they were all over my legs and buttocks and a bit on my neck and arms.  It was horrible!  Nothing helped; I tried all kinds of creams, lotions, ointments, medicated and non-medicated.  A friend of mine said it looked like 'jungle rot.'  My skin started clearing up soon after I started weaning off of the Cymbalta and I no longer have the skin problems but I have numerous scars.

column1: 860$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$3/14/2013 3:44:57 AM$Reviewer: laurj
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$2$2$Cymbalta did help my depression/anxiety problems and may have helped my muscle pain but it gave me a rash.  I got small round red patches that skin would crust over like a scab and flake off of and if I did not use clotrimizole on it
column3: it got redder and redder til it would bleed.  It itched and was painful. Unfortunately
column4: the cause wasn't obvious
column5: and for years I suffered with this. I went to 4 dermatologists who acted like they knew just what it was but their prescription didn't work. They all said not to use clomitrizole but it was my only relief. Finally
column6: Dr. tried to increase my dose of cymbalta from 30 to 60
column7: and then to 90 and the rash was worse than ever
column8: and the lightbulb finally went on above my head. I stopped taking cymbalta very gradually because it reeked havoc with my stomache with each tiny bit I decreased. The rash was gone for the first time in years I didn't have one of those painful itchy spots.  I was without the rash for 3 months when my depression problems came back. I tried cymbalta again and the rash came back worse than ever.  I hope this helpful to anyone with skin problems of any kind. Test for yourself and don't put all your faith in doctors telling you it has nothing to do with your meds. And read side effects and warnings in more than one place. I had to read a lot of info til I found the warning in small print to discontinue if you get a skin flaming rash. I should have run across that warning a lot sooner.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$3$1$"cymbalta is very potent stuff one of the biggest problems of this med is

column1: 1) that its half life time is so short.
2) that it is only available in 30mg and 60 capsules.
I started with 30mg in the morning in hospital (had a very deep episode) and it gave me some help with my agitation and panic attacks after a few days.

But it was not enough. I was very numbed and one of my key problems - anhedonia was very serve. After trying 60mg in the morning after some days I was sucidial with serve agitation and anxiety. After two weeks not getting better I went back to 30mg and after 2 days anxienty and agitation was gone again.
After 3 months I found my medication:
ONLY 7
column2: 5mg - 7
column3: 5mg - 7
column4: 5mg (have to open the capsule)

column1: and 25mg Ritalin in the morning.
My old doc said that this dosage is not enough but i have tried it several times - with more cymbalta and with less cymbalta and everytime after some days things got really bad.
I have pleassure to work and some pleassure in activities with friend and one of the best things: My libido has returned after 3 years.
I take in addition to that 6
column2: 5mg Metafolin and 1
column3: 5g buffered vit c the day and I think this stuff works too! "

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$5$"I started Cymbalta back in March of 2012 and took it for 6 days and couldn't handle the side effects (anxious
column3: nervous
column4: pacing
column5: excessive sweating
column6: sleep deprived
column7: nausea
column8: dry mouth
column9: and body twitching). I just quit taking it and thought I'm gonna have to live with this Fibromyalgia and Spinal Osteo Arthritis. In July 2012
column10: my Dr convinced me to give it another shot because he said the side effects would diminish over time. I restarted it in July and muscled through the first 2 weeks at 30mg and then bumped up to 60mg. I can honestly say it was worth sticking it out
column11: because my Fibromyalgia is almost non-existent now. I still have problems with my Oseto Arthritis
column12: however
column13: Cymbalta has greatly minimized this pain. As far as any remaining side effects
column14: it's very minuscule now and not bothersome enough to stop taking Cymbalta. My sex drive is normal
column15: I have more energy
column16: and I lost 25 lbs during the last 6 months of taking this medication.

column1: NOTE:  I also have hypothyroidism and take Levothyroxine. Believe me anyone who has an underactive thyroid knows how difficult it is to lose weight. Cymbalta did not make me gain weight or increase my appetite.
My recomendation for anyone experiencing dry mouth
column2: which I do still occasionally
column3: keep a water bottle with you at all times. It really will help to keep you hydrated as well as help your kidneys and liver to function normally. Don't skip any doses
column4: you will get shakey and feel like you stuck your finger in an electric outlet. I hope this helps anyone considering this medication for pain control. Good luck!!!  "

Abnormal dreams--This was one of the first side effects I experienced.  I still get them when I am running low on sleep

column2: but I have gained approximately 5lbs. above my normal weight since starting Cymbalta.  It's not a huge difference
column3: but I prefer the relief over the weight issue

column1: Cymbalta is incredibly expensive

column1: 977$Condition: Neuropathic Pain$11/25/2012 12:42:34 AM$Reviewer: Bellapamela
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$3$after being on Desipermine for over 15 years I switched to cymbalta. The med has worked GREAT for me and controls my neuropathy feet pain AND BACK PAIN for the most part. I also have knee pain for arthritus and need surgery and it has not done well for that. But I do like cymbalta ALOT but if I skip any meds at all I have painful sharp pains in my head 2 days later even if I took it the next day and continued. I have had a problem with restless leg syndrome due to this med and take Merepex with it. I would be alot happier since it does control my pain if i didnt have rls. Biggest problem is that this med costs a fortune and i went into the medicare gap  the first of October. They say I will hit the gap every Oct with this exspensive med. So I couldnt afford it last month. I went into a bad depression coming off it and cried every day. Fortunately I was able to get some given to me this month and can make it again till medicare med kicks back in in Jan 2013. MY DR SAYS I AM HIS ONLY PATIENT TAKING 120ML WHICH IS ALOT. I think I got medicare disability when the judge saw how much I was taking of this med. When I went off last month cold turkey and now have started back I have personally cut my dose back down to 30ml a day again and am doing ok with that. I dont want to take the higher dose unless I need to again. Cant wait till this goes generic so the money is do issue. By the way I know alot of other family members taking this and everyone seems to love it for pain or depression isses. And you dont seem to gain weight from it like you do with Lyrica. Hope this helps.

column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$4$5$Took 60mg Cymbalta daily for 2 months for depression.  Nothing noticed until 2 weeks after I'd been taking it.  Then a little mood boost on the surface only (still depressed deep down) and some anxiety relief as well as just more patience with people in general.  Side effects of increased appetite(but no subsequent weight gain) and abnormal sleep periods also began after 2 weeks but the sleep cycle got back to normal after another month.  Unfortunately after 2 months the mood boost and anxiety relief were gone and I was back to my normal levels.  Didn't pursue a dosage increase though in retrospect maybe I should have.  This is one of the few antidepressants out of many that I have tried that I would consider giving another shot to.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$1$1$"I suffer from nerve injuries and depression

column14: I only tried 20mg and had to quit after a week - I couldn't even go to the office. I felt like I'd been hit by a Mack truck.

column1: Cymbalta flattens out the mood to pleasant- no big highs or lows. I did not feel suicidal as they warn you might (only when I'm on no antidepressant do I feel that way!). But I wanted to feel like myself again; it was like watching myself from the outside
column2: in a movie.

column1: Be careful weaning off! Give your brain a chance to adapt slowwwly; never stop cold turkey! I've just been RX'd Elavil because I asked for something in low dose (10mg) in tablet form and can be cut in 1/2. You need to work with your Dr to find what's best for YOU."

column7: but my husband thinks I'm a nicer person on it! Overall
column8: it has solved my two most pressing issues....anxiety and neuroopathic knee pain. "

column1: 1100$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$8/12/2012 8:36:04 AM$Reviewer: DLMCD1966
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $2$1$1$"I had a quack psychiatrist prescribe a maximum  manufactures suggested dosage of this drug and it was within manufacturers guideline but I felt like this doctor was getting some sort of kick backs from drug companies or something to kick expensive drugs because he would never prescribe a generic and he took me off drugs that worked and put me on drugs like this that did not work.  I have been bipolar for years and have used many drugs and this is the worst of all of them.  One night I started getting really confused while doing my job as a route delivery driver to retail stores.  I called my father who is elderly because I did not know what else to do and I was confused.  He called my employer and took me to the hospital.  It struck me as odd right off the bat that they put me in a room with a person with liver failure?  Then finally after days of testing a group of 4 doctors visited me before I was released and gave me the diagnosis.  I had hepatic encephalopothy  or water on the brain from a liver problem they claimed was caused by this drug.  While I made a full recovery I must say that when they say on the television ""liver problems sometimes fatal"" have been reported they mean it.  Of course the original prescribing doctor wanted to argue with the diagnosis of the 4 hospital doctors and I told him off and fired him in a dramatic way.  Now after years on meds for bipolar I must say I think this is the most dangerous drug I have ever taken and I cannot urge people enough to try other options before trying this drug.  Water on your brain is a sign of a failing liver and my doctors insist that this drug caused it. Thankfully there has been no permanent damage that is showing and my liver function tests are back in normal range.  I am afraid of this drug.   "

1168$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$6/14/2012 7:47:49 PM$Reviewer: lisad, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$5$first time taking this pill. was skeptical of reviews i read but glad i did. i'd have went to ER otherwise. remembering what i read as side affects people talked of, i realized what i was experiencing was typical. i took 30mg at 5pm along with gabapentin 600m & celebrex (have taken for 2 yrs. went to bed @10 & woke up at 1am with severe nausea. sat up,felt very dizzy,weird, confused. felt very hot & sweaty like a hot flash i had on tamaxofin (breast cancer drug) but a months worth at one time! i panicked, felt sick so went to bathroom. had diarrhea. my head started to feel weird like i was out of body. my eyes felt weird & i tried to look at myself but couldn't focus in mirror. i was scared. made it back to bed, husband asked if i was ok, mumbled mmmm, because i felt like i couldn't speak-he went back to sleep. i sat on the edge of bed, i felt like i couldn't sit still but at the same time couldn't move my body only my eyes. still felt hot& panicky. my heart didn't feel like it was racing so i calmed myself down, after @20mins i was able to calm down& felt myself cooling down. i was afraid it would start again. finally laid back down & laid awake 2 hrs feeling dizzy, scared & like i was out of my body. after 2 hrs fell asleep & woke up at 5:15 w/husband & told him what happened. when i woke up i felt weird,foggy & went back to sleep for another 2 hrs. woke up less foggy but still so. it's 1pm 12 hrs later & i still don't feel right. it was so scary & bizarre. hard to believe it happened. i'm getting ready to report this to my doctor & FDA. i won't be taking this drug after this one & only time. never had a reaction to any med so i was suprised this happened. so thankful for all of you that have reported on the affects of this drug, for without that i would have been at the emergancy room last pm thinking i was literally ready to die. i felt like someone had tranqualized me & i would pass out. my advice is to stay calm & try to ride the affects out, & notify DR asap.

1175$Condition: Neuropathic Pain$6/7/2012 1:10:14 PM$Reviewer: TPS, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have PHN due to complications of shingles which I've had more than a few times. The PHN (and the shingles pain) is the worse pain that I've ever experienced in my life, and I've had FOUR babies and multiple elective surgeries. With PHN, my nerves are on fire 24/7, and it never ends, unlike childbirth which does end, and you have a precious new life to show for the pain. Cymbalta has really helped my neuralgia pain, and I thank God every day for Cymbalta. I do have very vivid dreams on this medication. It's like watching a movie in the theater! This is fine with me because my nerve pain is better since I've been on Cymbalta. I believe that it has also helped the degenerative arthritis in the cervical and lumbar region of my spine which also hurts. I'm allergic to Neurontin and Lyrica. I had severe reactions to both of those, as in not being able to breathe. Thank God my physician finally put me on Cymbalta because it has really helped me. I've been on it for 2 years now with no problems.
1176$Condition: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender & Painful Muscles$6/6/2012 12:36:51 AM$Reviewer: Steve, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$5$4$Diagnosed with Fibro 6 years ago. column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$3$"Today I took one Cymbalta 20mg for the first time
column3: after weaning off of Remeron the past 4 nights.  Every Doctor for the past 2 years told me the Remeron was supposed to help me sleep
column4: but it kept me awake 2-3 hours after taking it.  It also stimulated my appetite 1 hour after taking it.  So it put 10 lbs on me.  When I changed pharmacies earlier this year due to my insurance
column5: my new pharmacist told me Remeron can cause insomnia.

column1: So I talked to my new doctor
column2: and he prescribed Cymbalta.  But after taking it once today around noon with food
column3: it made me very sleepy and just ""weird"" feeling in my head the rest of today.  I had to talk with clients on the phone today
column4: and I had trouble getting my thoughts together and my words out to them... not good !

column1: After the Cymbalta wore off a little about 4 hours later
column2: then my anxiety kicked in.  So I have been taking Ativan for anxiety
column3: but I played it safe today
column4: taking only 1/4 of my 1mg Ativan
column5: and even that small amount made me more sleepy and feeling weird in my head with the Cymbalta in my system.

column1: Then I started feeling flushed in my head and chest.  So I am calling my Doctor tomorrow and I am not going to take anymore of it.  I just can't be that sleepy and ""out of it"" during the day due to my job.
I have also tried Wellbutrin for 1 month which caused major insomnia
column2: and then it took 3 weeks to wean off of it which also caused ""rebound insomnia""... that is one very bad med
column3: at least for me.

column1: I also have tried Lexapro which didn't help.
I have tried Paxil
column2: but stopped it after 2 days of very painful sexual side effects.

column1: So I don't know what else my Doctor can prescribe for me.  I have felt so rotten for over 2 years now with little energy.
I started taking a year ago Vit D pills and increased the iron in my diet
column2: as both levels were very low a year ago.  My recent blood test showed both levels are now in the normal range.

column1: So I hope this posting helps someone else out there."

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I had a nervous breakdown the first of January and my doctor tried me on Prestique first.  After a couple of days

I couldn't sleep; would pace the floor all night and day; started hallucinating and felt like I was going crazy; the end was the day I felt suicidal; I stopped and went back to my doctor.  She then tried Cymbalta (30 mg) and within a week I almost felt like my old self! We then increased dosage to 60 mg. and I am still on it.  It has made all the difference! 1204$Condition: Other$5/16/2012 12:24:09 AM$Reviewer: Jeannie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $3$3$3$This is my second time to take this Cymbalta. Both times I took 30mg and then increased to 60mg. The first time I took Cymbalta, it worked great with no side effects. When I decided to stop, I had really bad withdraws. It was aweful.  Since it worked so well, the next time I needed it (for mild depression and anxiety both times)I felt the withdraws would be worth it. I started out with 60 mg. and had bad side effects. I was flushed throughout the day. At night, I would wake up with sweats and seeing vivid flashes of light, hand tingling, and slight confusion.  I decreased to 30 mg. I still had the side effects but they only lasted a couple of nights. The flushing still happens and I get hot easily.  I have increased to 60 mg. and I am not getting any side effects except for slight flushing.  I am about to visit my doctor to stop taking Cymbalta again due to it not working as well this time for my depression and anxiety.  It is also very expensive if you do not have insurance or have a HSA like I do.  My opinion is that when it works, it works great, but if you experience side effects, it may not be worth it.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $3$3$5$I first was started approx 5 yrs ago on 60mg and dr increased to 120mg about 2 yrs ago. Not sure if it ever helped my depression problem or if changes in my life were really the culprit. Anyway I was remarried a year ago to the most wonderful woman who is a lifelong nurse and suggested I try to come off the cymbalta. I tried decreasing to 90 mg and after about 4-5 days was met with terrible brain shocks and just an awful overall feeling physically and mentally. I went back on 120 mg so we went to a neurologist who suggested I alternate days between 120mg and 90mg. Perfect! Never a bad day. I did this for one month
column3: then started only 90mg a day and have not had a problem. (started 90mg daily two weeks ago) Our plan is in two more weeks to start alternating days of 90 and 60mg. Yeah!!! It will take time but I will eventually be off this stuff. The side effects while not horrible

column5: difficulty urinating(not prostate problem)
column6: fatigue
column7: sleepiness
column8: vivid dreams
column9: lack of any drive. God sent me my the most caring and understanding support system
column10: my wife
column11: and that has helped ten-fold. I wish anyone wanting to quit this drug the best and please come off slowly. That's the key. God bless.

column2: 35-44 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$2$4$"I have taken Cymbalta since early 2010.  It has really helped with my depression.  I have also attended counseling.  However
column3: I have suffered from severe periods of nauseau and upper stomach pain.  IT is so bad that I have been to the ER several times.  (Usually treated like I am having drug withdrawls...not fun!!!)  I ended up having ulcers
column4: gastritis and having my gall bladder removed. (Which seemed to be the problem...)  However
column5: the periods of nausea
column6: upset stomach and sickness are still very bad. The surgey was 3 months ago.  I am very careful what I eat.  My ulcers have cleared- but still have gastritis- inflammation of the stomach...The only other medication that I take on a regular basis is Protonix- to help heal ulcers and inhibit stomach acid production.

column1: I have found that taking 60 mg of Cymbalata on an empty stomach - makes me feel very hot
column2: sweaty
column3: my stomach knots up. and usually it is so bad that I throw-up!!  It seems like taking a split dose of 30 / 30 creates less stomach upset.  However
column4: I have to watch taking the 2nd 30 mg too late in the day or I have trouble sleeping.

column1: I have to say I am very worried about the effects that Cymbalta has on my body and I think it would be smarter for me to find another medication for my depression....
After reading rare side effects- I have seen nausea
column2: stomach pain warnings and wonder about Cymbalta's effect on liver.  Through the years- I have taken antidepressants on and off for 25 years- so
column3: I have been on most- (forgive my spelling) TCA's
column4: prozac
column5: zoloft
column6: paxil
column7: lexapro
column8: effexor.. also combo trials with abilify
column9: zyprexia
column10: lithium
column11: geodone
column12: etc.  My problem doesn't seem to be a bipolar issue- more depression. Cymbalta seem to work best- as a stand alone-  I am still investigating..

column3: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $1$1$1$"I have found out after 7 years of BEING IN BED that antidepressants MAKE FIBRO WORSE!!!!  I took ALL of the antidepressants since 2002. My doctors took me off everything all at once and I had a break down.  They put me on Zyprexa and I didn't have pain for 3 years.  I went off Zyprexa and my fibro came back.  My doctor gave me Cymbalta.  At first it was like a miricle!!!  After 2 months my fibro came back
column4: only worse!  My doctor said to take two a day.  It was like a miricle again!  But then got even worse!  My doctor said to take three a day.  My muscles and tendons were as HARD AS STEEL!!!  I was in so much pain
column5: could not move
column6: wanted to kill my self!!!  This went on for 5 months!!!  My husband saw the Cymbalta commercial.  It said it ""might make your muscles cramp""!!!  So I went down one pill
column7: got better
column8: went down another pill
column9: got even better!!!  Went off
column10: and now my fibro pain is manageable!!!  Now I will NEVER TAKE AN ANTIDEPRESSANT AGAIN!!!  You must NOT eat processed foods and you MUST sleep 8 to 9 hours a night!!!  But now I only have to take half a norco to one norco two times a day!!!  Before I was taking 6 pain meds
column11: 6 norco a day!!!  The key is to sleep!!!!!  DR. OZ explained that the HGH is replenished AT NIGHT WHEN YOU SLEEP!!!!  So you must go to bed around 9pm!!!  I used to stay up all night in pain and it would only get worse.  You must sleep!!!!  Able to have a life now!!!  You have to be your OWN DOCTOR and try different things!!!  Streching is soooo helpful!!!  I went through 10 years of being an EXPERIMENT for all the doctors!!!  Don't put your self through this!!!!!"

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$4$5$"I was switched from Celexa to Cymbalta by my PCP because Celexa while helping to stabilize my moods was not improving my overall sense of well being; and I was already at the max dosage. We increased to 60 a day and my sense of well being improved gradually over 5 or 6 months. I've been on Cymbalta now for about 8 months and really feel the most 'normal' that I've felt in over 5 years. I've regained focus
column3: I hvae the desire to do things I haven't felt up to (i.e.: exercise
column4: enjoy hobbies...)in years.

column1: The major side effect for me is excessive sweating or hot flashes. It can be a little off putting but not enough to make me want to switch at this time. I also experience 'brain zaps' if I miss my dosing time by more the 24 hours. Of late I've had a sour milk taste and dry throat; however
column2: I'm hoping that has more to do with an atibiotic I had to take after oral surgery I recently had.

column1: Over all I'm pretty satisfied with my experience thus far on Cymbalta"

column1: 1363$Condition: Neuropathic Pain$1/7/2012 9:35:38 PM$Reviewer: Lost In Limbo
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$4$I was recently diagnosed with having something similar to Guillain-Barre Syndrome. After having bouts of numbing
column3: tingling and weakness my neurologist suggested that Cymbalta may help me get through some of the symptoms. After taking this drug for a week my symptoms had basically gone away and I was able to function normally once again.On top of that my mood had improved making coping even easier. I should also tell you that I also have a cyst on my left ovary
column4: which added to extra symptoms consisting of pain in my groin & armpit due to swelling of lymphnodes
column5: as well as pain in the area of my left ovary from swelling. The Cymbalta helped quite a bit and by the third week my excess symptoms we completely gone. There is no cure for Guillain-Barre Syndrome(which is a disorder that affects the nervous system) and it seems to be fairly unknown why it does what it does to the body. After completing a one month trial after being on a full dose for 3 weeks
column6: I had thought that my symptoms would stay away. But a week and a half after finishing they have started to return
column7: but so far not as not as strong as when I first became sick 3 months earlier. I feel that if I were to continue taking this drug for another month or so I might find myself healthy again. In the meantime- since there is no cure
column8: masking the symptoms with this drug is better than suffering through them without.Cymbalta is made mostly for being a mood enhancer and helping with pain associated with fibromyagia and other nerve pain
column9: since I mostly had numbing and strange sensations in my body I was surpised at how well it helped
column10: so I'm writing this for people who are in the same boat as I am
column11: who wouldn't ordinarily know about this medicine. It has totally saved me and gotten me throught the holidays as they were excrutiatingly busy. As for side effects
column12: I had trouble with my eye sight the first week
column13: some nausea
column14: and slight dizziness. Be Strong- If It's Happening To You Don't Lose Hope- It WILL Get Better.

At first I was in heaven w/ cymbalata for helping in the depression/mood swing area. No help that I noticed for back pain. Now,though I can relate to 90% of ALL posted side effects. What brought me here today  was my searching for answers in alot of the side effects I and my wife have noticed for a long time now. I have the MOST VIVID strange,nightmares you would not believe. They are so real,life like and absolutely chilling. When I wake even if its only been a couple hours of sleep I donot want togo back to sleep what so ever. I also have very bad day terrors of suicidal thoughts. I had at one time such a zest for life. A very active life in so many hobbbies I couldnt keep up. A Love for my family and friends that was boundless. I thourghly believe the after effects of being on cymbalata for such a pro long time is the cause of all these issues. I very rarely speak out on my issues but in this instance I felt an obligation to my fellow peers to share my expierence of using this drug. For those of you that are having great results, god bless you and your pains I know what a relief you must find. for those of you doing research please please talk this over in depth before taking the next step. Anyone wanting to ask me anything further on my use of cymbalta for any reason please email me at [email protected]

column3: then almost manically enthusiastic
column4: the difference from one day to the next. And within three months of taking Cymbalta I had gained ten pounds
column5: even though my diet was exactly the same.

column1: One day I was so depressed I almost started crying
column2: then I thought about my medication: I was taking 30mg of Cymbalta with 15mg of oxycodone each morning. So I stopped completely. So far I've had no withdrawal
column3: and my mood has become cheerful and even-keeled again.

column1: It seems counter-intuitive to have an anti-depressive actually cause depression and manic moods
column2: but I think this was a very insidious side-effect that took several months to notice. I hate to give it up but the depression and mood altering effects were worse than the pain."

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$5$"I have tried many meds for my depression and anxiety - probably every med on the market today

column13: lifesaving med

column1: 1455$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$10/18/2011 7:57:12 PM$Reviewer: kirksista5
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $3$1$1$"I had been on Cymbalta for chronic depression for little over a year. Not long after starting I kept having these episodes feeling like ""brain zaps""As soon as I lay down at night the zaps would start. Then they started to occur during the day. If I missed a dose the zaps would be worse. My PCP took me off of it about a month ago and the ""brain zaps"" haven't stopped but they're not a bad or often. A few days ago one morning I was about to get out of bed and all of a sudden I heard a sound like quickly letting air from a balloon. It was so scary; I got up quickly and walked around to make sure I was okay. Long story short I drove myself to ER because The right side of my face & neck was feeling very tight
column3: weak with severe pressure. Oh yeah I have RA
column4: Fibromyalgia and a pinched nerve in my neck[worse on right side]. I was admitted in the hospital because they wanted to run tests[ CT
column5: 3 MRI tests
column6: Ultrasound on my neck & heart]to see if maybe I was having a stroke or aneurysm. My mom died [49 yrs old]from an aneurysm and my older sister had 2 aneurysms that was caught in time to have surgery. After all the tests they could not find anything which I am so very glad to know because I had been telling my PCP & my husband that there is something wrong in my brain. I am no longer on Cymbalta but this episode of ""brain zaps"" really scared me. I pray that if anyone that reads this review and are having symptons such as this please tell your PCP so you can be weaned off this drug. I was weaned from 1[20mg]capsule 2 times a day to 1 time a day until I was finally taken off. My experience with Cymbalta has been very very very SCARY. "

column1: 1487$Condition: Chronic Muscle or Bone Pain$9/24/2011 2:52:55 AM$Reviewer: SKS
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $2$2$5$"I have been taking Cymbalta for Fibromyalgia and OA one month. Since starting it
column3: I have had erratic blood glucose readings (I am diabetic)
column4: unrelenting diarrhea
column5: excessive sweating and a few episodes of Restless leg syndrome
column6: which I've never had before.

column1: My doctor wants me to take this along with an anti seizure medicine that will dampen my sensitive nerve's overreaction to every stimulus. AND she wants me to gradually reduce my opiate therapy and wean off completely within 4 months. I am frightened
column2: but so disabled by pain at this point that I'm willing to try anything. I feel like I have no life now. Can't work
column3: can't go to school
column4: can't travel very far
column5: avoid activities outside of home. I can't even keep my house clean.

column1: I don't recognize the person I am when I hurt this much
column2: and I don't know how to get 'me' back.

column1: I'm going to stay on Cymbalta and the other med changes in hopes of some relief.
Still waiting for Social Security disability to kick in after three years.
If I feel well enough to have a life again
column2: I would be happy to withdraw my claim. This may sound crazy
column3: but if I could work again
column4: I would be so happy.

column1: For me
column2: the risk of side effects is worth the possible cure for my pain."

column1: 1491$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$9/21/2011 10:42:01 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $1$1$4$This drug is terrible and should come with warnings on the bottle. People need to be aware of what this drug can do to you. The company or companies that supply this drug purposely hide the truth from the public about this drug and others like it. I was on Cymbalta 60mg for about 2 years and the symptoms got so bad i had to quit taking it and the withdrawal from this drug is one of the worst and i almost had to go to the hospital several times. These drugs can make your symptoms worse and even add new ones. I would advise anyone not to take them without weighing the risks and determining yourself whether your symptoms are bad enough to risk taking a dangerous medicine like Cymbalta. The withdrawal from this medicine is terrible
column2: getting off this drug is said to be like getting off a narcotic. The withdrawal i went through made me wish i had never come into contact with this medicine or any like it. It was the worst week and a half of my life and i would do anything to never have to go through it again.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$2$"I was only able to take Cymbalta for 4 days before I had an episode where my heart was racing and I became nauseated and was sweating so severely it was dripping off my face and neck. This was such a scary experience I looked up side effects and drug interactions and learned I hadn't been warned about any of these. I called my doctor to inform her I would no longer be taking this medication as I believe the risks far outweighed any benefits. My heart was racing so fast I thought I was having a heart attack and with the profuse sweating and nausea
column3: I was ready to call for an ambulance! Please read all the drug interactions and warnings about existing medical conditions PRIOR to taking this medication.  In all fairness
column4: I never really got the chance to see if it helped with my mild depression and nerve pain because I was unable to take it for more than a few days. I am thankful I survived my trial of Cymbalta...sometimes the cure is worse than the actual disease!"

column4: anxiety attacks trouble sleeping . used to take this and it worked ok till i had the death of my mom and brother in 07 one month apart. took valium since i was 23 but it quit working for me . the benzoid drugs seem to work best ihave no side effects except i know its habit forming. i take xanes xr 2mg a day but at nite tho your not supposed to i take half because it helps me sleep. my other brother died in 09 my son died in 2010 on my birthday in nov. i am still taking xanex i also have no insurance im 63 have been on meds most of my adult life. on a fixed income etc. i hate being addicted to having taking meds but i know they are helping me get thru life.. i know the Lord is also helping me. i have been on xanex for4 yrs now. my new dr. says he wants to try me on something else i hope it works as well as the xanex.

In the beginning I had only minor side effects and they went away after a few weeks. The one side effect that has never gone away is a slight upset stomach right after swallowing the pills. I think this is due to the fact that the pills float. It takes a little getting used to swallowing floating pills. Overall I am very happy with this medicine. It has been the best medicine for me that I have ever tried. I also financially qualify for patient asisstance from the manufacturer so I get my medicine with no charge. Just a few forms to fill out. There is no, one-right-medicine-for-everyone, out there so if you try this medicine and it doesn't work for you just keep trying with your doctor to find one that does. I've tried ones that seem to have no effect and others that make me soooooo sick I think I'm dying I'm in so much pain. Cymbalta has worked for me and I intend to continue taking it for a long time.

column1: 1542$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$8/30/2011 3:23:19 AM$Reviewer: slrs87
column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $3$3$5$I was diagnosed with bipolar II approximately 18 months ago and I started taking Cymbalta approximately 1 year ago. To begin with it was extremely helpful with my moods and general feelings of depression. It has now become less affective and I am looking for an alternative. I experienced the normal symptoms of feeling like I would vomit (but never did) for approximately 8 months that subsided eventually. I also get what is referred to as 'serotonin' dreams where I have extremely vivid and life like dreams due to this antid. I hate this of course as it often leaves me waking up wondering if I recovered a memory instead of knowing I have just had another dream. This disheartens me greatly as I lived with depression for a number of years due to previously trying a number of antid's and getting hideous side effects until I tried Cymbalta. Now I am only left with the choice to see a psychiatrist to use me as a lab rat to test different drugs as no doctor ever knows exactly how you will react to a certain drug and the side effects you may have. Please don't let what I have written freak you out I just believe that knowledge is power and hope that maybe I could help someone. Thanks
column3: good luck and never stop trying to love yourself. Sarah (Mackay)
