column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$5$4$"I have been perscribed this medication due to sever depression and deep nerve pain.

column1: I have a fake disc that failed a buldging dics and L3 is almost bone on bone along with 3 bone disorders. Of course being in so much pain all the time and I've had 3 back surgery's with no luck and I'm only 30. Because of all this I have got major depression which sucks cause I have 4 kids as well and I have to try to stay positive around them even with all my back problems. I have tryed many anti-depresents Zolft
column2: Lexapro ect.. I started Cymbalta 30 mg twice a day and that really didn't seem to do it and I didn't have any real side effects. After a month I was switched to 60 mg twice a day and I must say I am very impressed. It does actually work for nerve pain and major depression "" More Depression then nerve pain though"" and still has very little side effects like you have with alot of other depression medications. If Cymbalta doesn't seem to be working for you talk to your doctor about increasing the dose. He will know best considering your condition. Good Luck and don't give up hope!! Fighting depression can be hard but there are people out there who care. Just sometimes they can be hard to find. don't give up hope!!"

column3: and as far as I'm concerned this medication should be banned! I took Cymbalta for nerve pain for 2 months due to nerve impingement in my neck. It worked fair. column4: short of breath with chest heaviness

column9: not weeks and get some expert advice
column10: and that may not be your Dr."

column1: I am on day 5 of no Cymbalta (but I am taking my prozac) and I feel like I have been on a 4 day drunk and still VERY tipsy. Do some quick online searches for Cymbalta withdrawal and you'll find MANY who have the same difficult time getting off this stuff. I did not find it to be any more effective than prozac and rated it a 2 for ease of use since you have to be so very careful not to miss an HOUR much less a dosage! I hate this stuff and am desperate to be out of this withdrawal stage. Be careful with this one
column2: especially if you feel you are one who can take this for a year.. get better and get off them."

column1: 3381$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$2/11/2009 10:26:34 PM$Reviewer: galinda
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$5$"I have been taking Cymbalta (60 mg) since November 25
column3: 2008 - 10 weeks. I felt immediate (approx 3-4 days) relief from my depression and anxiety (I tried 2 other antidepressants in September and October). I was surprized to find that I also lost the desire to overeat or self medicate.

column1: I have returned to work full time (the depression started November of 05 - I worked on and off until July 07
column2: then I was off work for 6 months). I am able to focus more (I could barely write a check before). I am not nearly as clear as I was before the depression but I can function for the first time in several years.

column1: There have been some disturbing side effects - very blurry vision
column2: shortness of breath
column3: and rather scary dizziness. I also feel rather detached - or perhaps it is just that I am not catastrophizing so much - I do not feel the need to analyze absolutely everything.

column1: These side effects scare me - I resorted to meds as I HAD to go back to work or I would have been homeless. I have also begun to have a tic (blinking my eyes) - one I had when I tried prozac years (16) ago (the last time I took antidepressants).
Would I rather not take this medicine? Yes. Did it save me at a critical point? Absolutely."

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been taking Cymbalta for about 3 years now.After taking Cymbalta for 2 weeks I was finally able to travel further than my neighborhood. I was a prisoner of my mind for about 30 years. I have also taken Prozac everyday for mild depression for about 20 years. When starting to fall asleep I do experience involuntary body jerks sometimes and
column3: I do get an electric shock feeling in my tongue followed by a metalic taste occasionally. The tongue zaps will wake me up from a deep sleep. I never had the body jerks or electric tongue zaps prior to taking the Cymbalta. BUT I can now leave my neighborhood!!! Thank goodness these side effects for me are not severe enough for me to stop taking the drug. I am no longer a prisoner of my own mind. I did have to work on my anticipatory anxiety but now it is mild since I have had so many positive experiences. The cymbalta so far has not allowed my anxiety to escalate to a full blown anxiety attack. I do take Ativan occasionally to help me get over major anticipatory anxiety. But now I rarely need to take the Ativan anymore.  The impossible for me is now possible thank GOD!!!! I also changed to a psychiatrist who is a pharmacologist. He's the one that put me on the Cymbalta. Don't give up there's a correct drug and dosage for you out there.

My psychiatrist is now trying to force me back on it or she will not continue seeing me as a patient.  After going off of it for 5 weeks, I reluctantly went back on 30 mg for one week but she wants me on 60mg.  I have taken as much as 120mg while hospitalized but I was a zombie.  The decision of going back on Cymbalta or not is causing more suicidal thoughts/plans.  I thought this drug was supposed to help.  If I end up back in the hospital they will just force it into me as they did before.

I personally do not take Cymbalta but a close family friend does.  This is effective when being used
column2: and I'm pretty sure it is pretty easy for him to use. I want to say that I have never been so sared of this man in all my life until just a week or so ago.  He ran out of his pills and it was a Sunday so the pharmacy wasnt open. No words can describe what this drug has done. I went over to their house to help with the draft horses.  It all started when the harnesses somehow got switched
column3: and thats when it all started.  He was screaming about everything
column4: cussing constantly and I finally understood waht his wife has described to be before.  I was so scared
column5: and I was with him alone in the barn plus 2 horses scared to death! He is ""addicted"" to it and can never come off of it ever.  If he did he would probably kill sombody
column6: and Im dead serious about that.  This drug made him like this
column7: I dead set on that!  He was never like this before he was put on this.  I hope and pray to God that nobody ever has to go through the things I have been through. I hope the makers of Cymbalta are happy about what they have done to him and all who care about him."

column1: 3462$Condition: Other$1/21/2009 7:26:02 PM$Reviewer: [email protected]
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$4$5$"I was put on this medication for post traumatic stress disorder from a near-fatal car accident in 3/2007
column3: which mimicked depression. I had already been treated for depression
column4: which I'm starting to realize is more ANXIETY with some situational depression. I also have ADD.

column1: This medication was miraculous for me at the time. I did go off Strattera
column2: which I was taking for the ADD
column3: because I wanted to make sure I wasn't overmedicating
column4: and for similar things.

column1: I never suffered any side effects
column2: and had ceased taking Prozac and other medications due to their sexual side effects.

column1: HOWEVER
column2: if/when I would miss a dose
column3: I would feel a ""sizzle""/ electrical impulse in my brain/twanging of a rubber band in my head. I started being more diligent about not missing doses
column4: and then started feeling them when I hadn't missed a dose! My doctor and I started the weaning process of 90mg/once per day
column5: to 60mg/once per day for about a week
column6: then 30mg/once per day for about a week. I even elongated this time frame as a precaution. I barely noticed any withdrawal until I was no longer taking the medication
column7: and it was clearing from my system. The sizzle/twanging in my head became a nightmare for me. I thought I was losing my mind
column8: and was crying all the time.

column1: The alternative actions were to take the meds every other day for a week or so
column2: or to take a small dose of prozac for about a few days
column3: then every other day for another few days... I chose the Prozac treatment for several days.

column1: This is NOT a medical promotion to do this on your own!!!! Please talk to your doctor before going off your medication. If I had not been talking to my doctor
column2: I probably would have checked myself into the hospital!

column1: Overall
column2: Cymbalta worked for me. I just didn't think it was a good idea to go to a higher dose
column3: and wanted to find another medication to combat the ANXIETY that had become more apparent as the cause
column4: as opposed to a symptom of my PTSD/depression.

column1: I hope this helps."

column1: 3494$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$1/12/2009 9:04:25 AM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $2$1$3$"I had been taking Cymbalta for approx. 1 year before deciding to stop using it.  I gained 35lbs+ while taking this medication.  The anxious feeling was increased while on this medication.  I finally went to a different doctor who actually listened to my complaints and agreed to help me wean myself off of it.  BEWARE!!!  The withdrawal symptoms are absolutely horrible.  It has been 2 months since I started the process of getting of the medicine.  There is a horribly scary feeling called ""brain zaps.""  Basically
column2: the neurotransmitters in your brain are fighting to find the Cymbalta it's so used to having...the result is that you feel incredibly dizzy and panicked.  The ""zaps"" occurred almost every minute.  The withdrawal symptoms were so bad.....I found myself relating to how drug addicts feel when they are ""coming down.""  Please talk with your doctor about the possible withdrawal symptoms.  Check out blogs of other people who have gone through the withdrawal.  Some day....the drug company may face a lawsuit.  "

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have been on Cymbalta for 3 years and have had no problems with side effects.  I have been treated for depression for 7 years and have tried over 5 medications during that time.  I was on prozac for a long time
column3: until the Prozac Poop-out hit and it no longer worked.  One of the frustrating things about depression and the way our bodies metabolize the medications is that the medication can stop working at any time & not all medications work on all people.  Some of the problems that people listed below
column4: I experience on other drugs.  For me Cymbalta is my miracle drug
column5: keeping me on an even keel with very few depressive episodes
column6: and even helping with my peripheral neuropathy (nerve damage) in my feet that I acquired from a chemo drug.  I am definately more ""ME"" on it.  No drug will work for all people or even forever.  If it doesn't work for you
column7: be persistant in looking for alternatives.  Work with a psychiatrist who knows all the medications/combinations available.  Don't take ""NO"" for an answer - only you know how you feel and only you will know when you have found the right drug.  Be your own health advocate or find someone to be one for you!  Best wishes to all for whom this doesn't work - keep pushing for the right drug - from someone who WILL BE on antidepresants for life!  (and not ashamed of it!) "

column17: so it makes sense that too much would cause huge problems...?  I have also noticed that the dry mouth I experienced at first has dissipated

column1: 3568$Condition: Other$12/12/2008 11:20:13 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$3$5$I was on Cymbalta for 1.5 years and it helped as far as depression.  I liked it quite a bit.  I still had emotions

column4: 1x/day.  I was tapered to 30mg
column5: 1x/day for one week
column6: and then nothing.  *** BEWARE *** if you are going OFF of Cymbalta.  The withdrawl symptoms are horrifying.  I had terrible depression and anxiety

column8: brain zaps
column9: crazy mood swings
column10: seeing things out of the corner of my eyes
column11: and more. The withdrawl symptoms (I've been told by my GP) can last up to 6 weeks as it clears out of your system.  I just passed week 3.  The first week is the worst.  Please prepare yourself by reading up on it and talking with your doc afterward.  Some in the medical profession are unaware of the withdrawl from this drug.  Make yourself aware first
column12: make your family aware and prepare yourself (you certainly may need to take time off work).  I hope this helps for anyone considering going off of Cymbalta.  It doesn't effect everyone this way

column1: 3583$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$12/10/2008 1:11:40 AM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $3$3$3$"I took this med for 9 months

column4: but I was tired all the time.  I gained 20 pounds during this time.  My legs feel jumpy and restless
column5: especially at the end of the day when trying to relax.  I recently tapered off the med
column6: but am having withdrawal symptoms even after 11 days of being off the med.  I had to taper to 30 mg a day for a month
column7: then 30 mg every other day for a few weeks
column8: then 30 mg every third day for a few weeks
column9: then every fourth day for a few weeks.  The first time I tried to stop after 30 mg every other day for a week
column10: I had headaches and lightheadedness.  Since stopping
column11: I have lightheadedness off and on throughout the day
column12: along with what feels like ""brain zaps.""  Some days I don't have any energy to do anything.  Other days are okay.  I hope the effects of this drug wear off completely soon.  "

"

column1: 3590$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$12/7/2008 8:27:24 AM$Reviewer: Pam
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$5$I lost 3 close family members (for various medical conditions ie: cancer
column3: stroke
column4: copd) including my mother in 2006.  In 2007
column5: it was all I could do to get up in the morning and I cried all the time.  I started Cymbalta in Feb 07 and it got me through the next year.  I am still on it but lost my job and w/o insurance it is VERY expensive.  In the last year I have gained at least 35 lbs and am EXTREMELY hungry ALL the time.  I am overweight and I am now going to the doctor to find out alternatives.  I did lose all my sex drive too.  But I don't cry and I am not moody unless I take antibiotics.  I recommend it to someone who cries for no reason to get through it!  I responded well to Prozac but it quit working and had to increase it.  Then tried Wellbutron and it worked well on my sex drive
column6: but it upset my stomach.  Lexapro was AWESOME but would quit after 3 months.  Effexor did nothing for me.  I think I will go back to Lexapro.

column1: 3595$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$12/4/2008 2:44:20 PM$Reviewer: Beth
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$4$"One thing I've noticed
column3: using Cymbalta
column4: is that it clears the depressive thoughts and negative mentality
column5: so that I can realize and evaluate things in my life that aren't working.  For example
column6: I hate my job.  I now realize that hating my job contributes a great deal toward the depression and negative outlook that descends over me
column7: when the depression gets bad.  So
column8: is hating my job (since it takes up a huge part of my life) causing most of the depression?  And
column9: if I had a good
column10: great-paying job
column11: would I still get depressed and want to die?  I can't remember being caught up in severe depression the few times I've ever had jobs I loved.  At least now
column12: using Cymbalta
column13: I can take an evaluative look at my life
column14: instead of just wanting to die
column15: in order to stop feeling horrible.  Taking the drug clears my outlook enough to help me see that I need to make some changes.  Cymbalta helps me feel more able to move forward with my life
column16: and gives me the strength to work on positive change.  The depression episodes tend to play mind games with me.  During them
column17: it feels like everything is hopeless
column18: and I'm too worn down and tired to fight any longer.  Cymbalta is helping me see that's not really the truth about my reality.  Overall
column19: I guess it's worth risking the potentially dangerous side effects and/or withdrawal effects of this drug.  I'm thankful to feel better about my situation and my life.  This is the closest to normal I've felt
column20: other than the first little while I was on Prozac.  I've never been a ""happy"" person
column21: but at least Cymbalta helps me feel OK about it."

I was able to walk up and dowm the stairs with relative ease. After the third week, I experienced severe stomach cramping, nausia,vomiting, migrain headaches,mental confusion, dizziness, high blood pressure(198/100), racing heartbeats in the chest and head,depression, nightmares and being easily startled both while asleep and awake.I stopped taking the medication after three weeks, but the effects have lingered. It has now been one month since I took the last pill.The nausia,dizziness,stomach gas have still not completely gone.This is the worse medication I have ever experienced.Take with extreme precaution if perscribed, and discuss this with physicians before embarking on a nightmare that could possibly control your life for a minimum of two months.

column5: I began getting worse and worse.  I would sit on the couch and not move
column6: or care about anything.  I decided I had to get off the medication (for fear I was going to hurt myself) and was advised to wean off slowly. column7: shower
column8: or take care of my daughter.  I couldn't work
column9: or drive.  After completely weaning myself off

column10: etc -- until I know this drug is out of my system. It's weird and I wonder if even those people who respond well ON this drug would have this adverse effect getting OFF of it. Not something to look forward to

column1: 3791$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$9/29/2008 5:14:10 PM$Reviewer: 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $3$1$3$"I am a 18 year old male who took Cymbalta for a little less then a year. Everything was fine until I began to notice that the symptoms of my depression were returning. This wasn't itself unusual because in the past the effectiveness of other anti-depressants would slowly wear off over time as well. With Cymbalta however
column2: I had a unique experience that I am still suffering through today and one that I would not wish on my worst enemies. Two days after I stopped taking it
column3: my memory
column4: concentration
column5: and happiness decreased to a hellish level. I would frequently have ""brain zaps"" and uncontrollable crying spells
column6: as well as extreme paranoia (I thought it was the end of me). I began to feel out of touch with reality and even my eyesight began to seem fuzzy and dreamlike. Physically
column7: I could not keep food down and threw up constantly as well experiencing digestive problems. My psychiatrist didn't know what was happening
column8: so
column9: as hard as it was with my apathy
column10: I took it upon myself to discover what was going on. I scoured the internet until I came upon information documenting ""SSRI Discontinuation Syndrome."" I'm sure others here have commented on it
column11: because it apparently is not an isolated condition. It was a living hell
column12: and six months later
column13: although a different medication(Prozac) has helped
column14: I still feel the effects. It's a rare occurrence
column15: and I know how devastating depression is
column16: but take my advice and be careful before you use this or any other SSRI. And
column17: if you ultimately do decide upon Cymbalta
column18: make sure that you taper yourself of very gradually; the consequences are beyond what I ever imagined even on my worst days of depression. Be safe
column19: good luck."

MAJOR ODD SIDE EFFECT....After taking years for my breast milk to dry up after the birth of my daughter

3878$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$8/26/2008 7:56:12 AM$Reviewer: Paula857, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I started taking Cymbalta about 6 mos. ago. I had been on Zoloft in the past and did not want to use anti-depressants again
column2: but this one was different.  It treated all of my symptoms and that included anxiety. THE DOWN SIDE IS
column3: and I wish Doctors would make it clearer
column4: that if you miss a couple of doses
column5: you could have bad withdrawal symptoms.  I didn't have money and missed a couple days
column6: no big deal right? Wrong! I started having these ""shock"" feelings.  Since I have a heart condition
column7: I called the Dr. but got no response. I started searching internet and found that ""startling"" or whatever I was feeling was common for Anxiety patients.  That led me to Cymbalta & side effects of going off it
column8: and sure enough.

column1: They called it ""brain zaps""
column2: ""brain shocks"" and so forth. It felt like electric shocks going through my body repeatedly and randomly.  Stress seemed to make it worse.

column1: Apparently
column2: you have to taper off very slowly. One lady even went so far as to open the capsule
column3: count the tiny beads and gradually reduce the amount in each pill!

column1: I LOVE THIS drug otherwise!! I actually feel good for the first time in years.
Not drugged; just good! I would recommend it to anyone not satisfied with other anti-dep. and those with fibromyalgia.  A lot of aches & pains I was having went away with Cymbalta.
I don't really feel any side effects either.  [Zoloft made me nervous and couldn't sleep or eat
column2: so Dr. gave me Xanax
column3: which is highly addictive. That’s another story.]

column1: 3879$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$8/25/2008 11:25:01 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$This was a miracle drug for me.  Work stresses had begun to manifest several symptoms in me
column2: the most notable being high blood pressure.  (I had gone from 130/85 to 200/100.)

column1: I was given lysinopril for the blood pressure
column2: and it only worked when I was at work; it made me sick otherwise.  It lowered my blood pressure too much.  My physician also gave me cymbalta.  That was a different story.

column1: After a couple days of taking cymbalta
column2: I realized something was different; my spinal cord stopped aching.  I didn't even realize that it had started aching.  I sure noticed when it stopped.  Instead of ""longing for death"" (just an expression
column3: not truly literal.) I began to feel hopeful that I could take control of my life again.  It gave me the space and the perspective to make changes in my life.  A new job on the horizon
column4: laughter with my wife and I've been off all medication for over a year.  That's the great thing.  I only needed to take the cymbalta for 3-4 months.

column1: I've heard that the best depression treatment results occur when the first medicine works.  If you are looking for that first treatment and you ache from depression and feel like there is no solution possible
column2: consider asking your doctor for cymbalta.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$5$Been taking Cymbalta for a few months now. For the first week - I was started on a 30mg dose to acclamate my body. Lot's of nausea & sleepiness. Then I ramped up to the 60mg dose where I turned into a Zombie & did not interact with my kids or wife. After a month or 2 of taking a 1 hour nap after work & typically missing dinner
column3: I asked my Dr. to drop it down to 30mg. Now I experience the sleepiness again. I did find that Cymbalta helped me straighten out
column4: but my depressive thoughts did not go away - they were only suppressed. I was & continue to be very negative about work
column5: as I am a small business owner who has suffered the most trying time in my career of over 20 years (financially). I believe for me Cymbalta was the right thing to do as I think it has had me focus on what is making me feel this way. I hate what I do. My insecurity has taken a huge toll on my physical & mental being. I am going to ask my Dr. to ween myself off of Cymbalta only for the reason I don't know how much more this can help me. I hope all of you find the correct doseage / treatment & can get back to being yourselves. Give it time & understand there are things you simply can't change in the world.

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$5$"Cymbalta has helped control my muscle

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $2$1$4$I've been on Cymbalta since January 2008
column3: about 6 1/2 months. For the past three months or so I've found myself drinking much more than I have since my days in college. (I'm 62 so that should give you an idea.) I've never been a teetotaler. I like wine and beer but always have been able to control my intake. However
column4: since starting on Cymbalta once I start drinking (especially red wine) I find myself unable to stop. I've had more hangovers in the past three months than I've had in 40 years. column5: read health sites and you'll find my situation is quite common.

column3: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$5$"I have Fibromyalgia
column4: Neuropathy down my legs and arms and was very fatigued. Since starting Cymbalta I have almost no hip pain
column5: my mood is greatly improved and I have quite a bit more energy.  I take it right before I go to bed because it does make me sleepy.  I also take Methadone for chronic pain but adding the Cymbalta has really halped me alot.

column1: My husband was diagnosed 8/4/08 with a relapse of his lung cancer and now it is throughout his vertebrae and some lymphnodes. I am thankful I'm on the Cymbalta to help with the stress.  I seem to sleep better even though I have a C-PAP machine for sleep apnea.  My 4-year old has been happy to see ""momma"" have more energy and be more jovial rather than grumpy.  I wake up more refreshed in the mornings and have a better outlook on life.  I recommend everyone with Fibromyalgia and/or Neuropathy to try it
column2: however I don't recommend it to replace any existing pain medication(s) you might be taking.  It is a good enhancement to any current meds you might be taking.

column1: Thank you and may God bless everyone who reads this!  Cherokeedeer (""Cecilia B."")"

column1: 3929$Condition: Other$7/22/2008 12:40:42 AM$Reviewer: sweetpea
column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $2$1$1$"This is my second post. I just wanted to let every one know there can be life after Cymbalta. I took it for over three years
column3: and when it wasn't working any more I wanted to get off of it. I was taking 60 mg. and my Dr. gave me 30 mg. and told me to take one daily for four days
column4: then one every other day for three doses
column5: and I should be OK. Well after a week of being off of the medication I was very sick. I went to the Dr. and he thought I had a stomach bug. I was very nauseated
column6: cramping
column7: and diarrhea. He gave me a medication for nausea
column8: and said I should be fine in a few days. Well another week went by
column9: and I was worse really thought I was  going to die. I tried to get back in to see him
column10: and couldn't get an apt. so I called a Dr. friend that I used to work for that had moved away
column11: and she told me that my Dr. took me off of it too fast. That I should taper off one daily for two weeks
column12: then one every other day for two weeks
column13: then one every three days for two weeks. I called my Dr. and asked for more medication
column14: and started taking it again after being off for two weeks. I did like my Dr. friend told me
column15: and I have been without a pill for 6 days now
column16: and I am feeling a lot better. My advice for any one trying to get off is not to stop it suddenly
column17: but taper off like I did.On my first post I gave my e-mail address
column18: and I have had four women contact me. I have started a little support group for any one that would like to contact me to discuss what they are going through. One of my new e-mail friends named it the DEVIL PILL. It has really been nice having some one to talk to
column19: and to know that I am not going through this alone. This is a terrible drug I will never take it again. I can't believe it is sold legally
column20: it should be a street drug. The two weeks I was off before tapering off is the worse I have ever felt. Good luck to all of you that are going through this. My prayers are with you.

column5: the Cymbalta didn't have near the brain zaps you suffer when you forget to take a dose -- I could forget a dose of Cymbalta for a day or two and be fine. Now
column6: this sound contradictory
column7: but my big hang-up comes after deciding that I wanted to see if I could go pill free. In short
column8: Cymbalta has/was been VERY hard to ween off of. I stupidly tried ""cold turkey"" and that was a HUGE mistake -- I do not recommend it to anyone. I was pretty much bed ridden for 3 days -- sleeping
column9: dizzy and nauseous... it hurt to even open my eyes. I then listened to reason and had my family doctor work me through a weening phase over a month which was more bearable
column10: though the brain zaps was pretty continual
column11: but not NEARLY as bad (you'd have to have experienced them to know what I'm talking about -- if you have -- you know exactly what I mean -- it's hard to explain the feeling). The last week I was trying to pull apart the 20mg caplets and guesstimate what half the granules was
column12: but figured I was making a bigger mess than just stopping altogether. It's now been 4 days (as of 7-8-08). The brain zaps are still there
column13: but very tolerable. Fortunately
column14: I think I'm through it. I did this a year ago when on Paxil (weening off) and it was not NEAR this bad."

column10: you name it it happened to me. I had used other SSRI's and they worked for depression & anxiety (phobias completely gone) but when I developed fibromyalgia
column11: my life was no longer worth living and I broke down physically and mentally last Christmas.  I immediately went to my doctor
column12: scheduled counseling and began Cymbalta. Four months later I have discarded my handicapped parking sticker
column13: my cane and am now biking 60 miles a week
column14: and for the first time in years
column15: I found myself SMILING out of the blue one day
column16: even the muscles that controlled the smile twitched because it had been so long.  This drug was exactly what I needed to balance my life again. I am truly *happy* for the first time in my life despite my grim medical outcome. I have placed my problems in perspective now
column17: thinking much clearer. When I think that I was ""this"" close to ending my life I realized that it COULD be pain-free and bountiful. The only side effects I had were actually helpful
column18: loss of appetite and incresed sexual desire.  I sweat like a sumo wrestler but it is worth every extra shower I take to feel this whole again. BTW
column19: fibromyalgia is far worse than the cancer pain and was GREATLY helped by this drug.  I am so grateful for it!"

column1: 4091$Condition: Other$4/18/2008 2:53:32 PM$Reviewer: jstmekim
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $2$1$5$I am just starting to take this for Fibromyalgia
column3: the Dr has me starting out on 30mg then going back to see him in 1 month.  After reading all these reviews I am half afraid to try taking it and would love to talk to other people who are on it for Fibromyalgia.  On top of the Fibro
column4: I have migraine headaches and even with taking Ambien
column5: Ambien CR and Sonata at different times I do not sleep good.  It takes me forever to fall asleep
column6: I wake up a few hours later and then lay there til morning. I have been on many different anti depressants over the years
column7: some working ok for a while and others not seeming to do anything at all so my Dr. felt Cymbalta might help.  I have experienced weight gain with other drugs and now fear this one will make me gain weight and I already weigh enough from other drugs and have not been able to lose any of it.  As I said if you have Fibro and are taking this please email me
column8: just put webmd Fibro in the subject line so I don't delete you!  I am also wondering when the best time would be to take it
column9: morning or not to be ablemto hopefully sleep at night? I plan on starting this tonight
column10: thought taking it at night might be better but now I'm not so sure.  My email is [email protected]   Thanks!

column1: 4094$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$4/16/2008 1:53:04 PM$Reviewer: Tim
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years$4$4$5$"I've been on Cymbalta now for two years
column3: and it has worked better than anything else I've taken
column4: especially in terms of side effects.  I started off on Lexapro
column5: but it didn't seem to work for long
column6: and the sexual side effects were driving me crazier than the depression.  My psychiatrist added Wellbutrin on top of the Lexapro
column7: but that made me feel like a maniac after just one day
column8: so I stopped taking it.  Then he switched me to Cymbalta.

column1: My only concern lately is that I'm having some bouts of depression here and there.  I've been trying to take a ""mental inventory"" to decide if it's all situational depression
column2: but this latest bout has me thinking that maybe my dosage needs to be increased
column3: or it's time to find something else.

column1: I have noticed the weight gain ever since I started taking this medication.  I've ballooned up about 40 pounds since I started taking Cymbalta.  I had no idea so many others were experiencing this as well.  I'm having trouble losing this weight
column2: too.  "

column1: 4095$Condition: Repeated Episodes of Anxiety$4/16/2008 11:37:23 AM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$1$4$Lots of recent posts on withdrawal...takes time but I started weaning myself and then just went cold turkey.  Brain zaps
column2: fuzzieness etc lasted about 4 weeks.  Afterwards the hormonal swing of midmonth/perimenpause was HORRIBLE.  Don't know if it's related to withdrawal or not but am taking Wellbutrin now.  Weight gain was a big issue
column3: night time bingeing was unstoppable.  WEIRD dreams and night sweats also became common after about 5 months of usage
column4: that's why I stopped.  Great for leg cramps that I often had at night but not worth all the other side-effects.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$4$"I have had problems with depression off and on for a few years. I have tried several anti-depressants
column3: but this combined with lamictal has improved things. I used to be really angry

column1: Side effects noted were nausia the first week. I work nights
column2: so I took it in the morning before I went to sleep to reduce this. Sexual disfunction is mostly indifference and delayed orgasm. I can even tell I am dreaming and cannot get out of it and if I do wake up

4100$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$4/15/2008 2:58:29 AM$Reviewer: bunzies, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $3$1$5$i have already made a couple of entries-going through withdrawls from this med-nausea, brain zaps, tremors, achiness, mood swings, etc..anyhow, i'd been trying to wean off cymbalta, -first from going from 60 every day, to 30 every day, then 30 every other day, etc..sick as a dog still,--saw my dr. today--he told me that the withdrawls from this drug, and most other drugs is six weeks from the last dose taken--i almost wish i had stopped cold turkey, because i've been feeling crazy and putrid for about eight weeks now, and still have six more to go--oh joy!! but he said i should feel alot better in a couple of weeks, and then keep improving--i find that when i read about everyone else having these withdrawl symptoms, its a bit easier, and then finding out that the mood swings are also common, is helping-am going to try hot baths, and i heard that niacin is helpful for detoxifying drug addicts, so will probably try that--i think the cymbalta may help some people--i thought it was good at first (took away cronic pain but didnt help depression), but then everything got worse, and i had pain everywhere, gained weight even though i eat hardly anything and am vegetarien and exersized, lost motivation for the things i used to like to do--even positive self talk didnt work--so for those of you who are having a wonderful time on this med, i hope you know that it has horrid withdrawl symptoms--i hear that cymbalta, effexor, and paxil have the worse withdrawl symptoms (from dr.) and that it is worse than heroin withdrawl, and believe me, they're not kidding--i wish i was warned about this before taking this drug--at one point i thought i was dying from something--i wish the best of luck to all of you that are withdrawing from this
4101$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$4/14/2008 10:01:11 PM$Reviewer: bunzies, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $1$1$5$

4117$Condition: Neuropathic Pain$4/9/2008 12:25:20 AM$Reviewer: Maine mom, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$After using Wellbutrin for about 4 yrs. my dr. switched me straight over to Cymbalta to maybe help my chronic back pain. So, I stopped it, cold turkey, after about 1 week no chest pain, again. The doctors didn't see this as a side effect so they never had me stop. I wouldn't recommend this drug to anyone, the doctors - I feel can't monitor these wild side effects.

4123$Condition: Other$4/7/2008 11:11:57 AM$Reviewer: Crissy, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $1$1$1$I have moderate and seasonal depression. When I first started taking the drug it was hard for me. Nausea
column2: dizziness. That did lessen. Then I learned what happend when you miss a dose. Dizziness
column3: nausea. I have suffered from constant tiredness since taking Cymbalta as well as mood swings and severe sexual dysfunction. I have read all the post. I do wish I would have done my own research before my gynocologist put me on this. I also wished he would have warned me about the side effects prior to putting me on it. He basically said here ya go. I was on 60mg a day. I had to stop taking it ""cold turkey"". My doc was out of samples and could not afford to fill the RX. I was on it for 8 months. I feel like I am going through detox. I am dealing with it though. I am so very tired but I am making myself get out and do what I need to do. Sunshine is helping. I am so nauseus. The diahrrea is coming on. But I am going to an herbalist to see what I can get to help me. If anyone has any suggestions please e-mail me at [email protected] I am not saying take or not take it. I just stress that a person do there own research. I am so glad that i came across this portion of the website. It has helped me to know that some of the symptoms I am feeling are common and that lessens my fears. Also it helped me to see that the issues I was facing (insomnia
column4: night sweats
column5: fatigue lack of sex drive) were common as well. Thanks for all the post. It has helped me tremendously."

column1: 4124$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$4/7/2008 10:07:41 AM$Reviewer: wishingonastar
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$2$5$"I was diagnosed with depression and had been taking Cymbalta for 5 months.  When the doctor upped my dosage to 60mg. I looked wonderful
column3: 10 years younger(no joke)
column4: and didn't worry about anything- so unlike myself.  I was a new person :)  Suddenly my gums started bleeding (don't know whether it was Cymbalta related.   I started getting really irritable and lost two of my best friends due to my overeactions to their comments.  Was heartbroken because they were the ones who suggested that I go for treatment.   I tried going cold turkey
column5: but couldn't
column6: so the doctor switched me to something else on a very low dosage every other day.   With this medication I had vivid dreams
column7: sweats
column8: buzzing in the ear (only when originally getting on and coming off this medication)

column1: The upside to the whole experience was that I finally didn't overeact - I only wish I was naturally like that.  I was outspoken and made friends easily (something I could never do)  It was very effective but only for a short while- I wish I could have lasted on it.
Suggestion:  NEVER go cold turkey without going too the doctor.

4125$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$4/7/2008 12:42:59 AM$Reviewer: amanda, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$5$Just started taking Cymbalta tonight,will keep you updated on my progress
4126$Condition: Other$4/6/2008 1:01:27 PM$Reviewer: kaleuo, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$4$2$I was placed on this for Fibromyalgia and it has worked exactly as it was supposed to. It has stopped the nerve cell/stimulus overreaction. I now sleep better and have less pain. The problem is that it seems to occasionally affect the effectivness of my anti-depressant medication (Wellbutrin) so I have to time the dose of Cymbalta to be late enough in the day to not cause problems with it, yet early enough not to cause insomnia. Could be worse though, at least it works and I feel much better on it. It was no use as an anti-depressant but it works for the Fibro and that is what matters.

I no longer have any desire at all - looking for new treatment. 
4128$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$4/5/2008 12:26:14 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more$1$1$5$i began taking this drug for depression, a couple of years ago-i felt ok at first, some pain i had from an injury went away,which helped me feel better emotionally (cronic pain sucks)--Then i started to feel worse-gained weight, became irritable, stressed out, unable to get out of bed-too tired, and was having horrible pain in my joints and back, making it hard for me to get out of bed physically, also--i decided to change to Wellbutrin, because i read that most people lose weight rather than gain it, and have discovered that since i've been weaning myself off cymbalta, that most of my pain is gone. of course, i also am having the disgusting withdrawl symptoms from cymbalta-nausea, vommiting, dizziness, electric zaps in my head(had those when i started cymbalta,also), --i began weaning off the cymbalta by going from 60mg to 30mgs every day, then 30mgs every other day, and now am trying 30 mgs every third day-i've been doing this for about 6 weeks now--am hoping to not be too nauseated tomorrow--last week skipped one extra day, and paid for it with nausea,..had to take a dose for 3 days straight--i don't think many drs know what this is like--they should recommend anyone wanting to get off cymbalta to go to a drug detox center, because it is a nightmare getting off of it--

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $3$1$3$"I have been taking Cymbalta for almost 14 months now.  I have tried other drugs for depression
column3: nothing else has worked for me.  I thought Cymbalta was a wonder drug.  I was still depressed while taking it

column11: and of course

column13: high pulse rate

column15: terrible insomnia
column16: frequent urination

column1:

4138$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$4/1/2008 2:03:43 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$4$5$I was on this for 9 months, up to 90mg a day.  Had the usual side effects but no other medication helped my depression as Cymbalta.  I couldn't believe the difference.  Now my new insurance doesn't cover it so I have to wean off it.  Now I have the brain zaps, lack of energy, dizziness, etc. from withdrawal that others have described on here.  Its is horrible, can't function hardly at all.  Would like to  other peoples schedules of getting off this stuff.  I am currently on 30mg. and taking one pill every 3 days now.  Just wondering how long others had to take it and what their final schedule was when they finally stopped.  So glad I read the withdrawal posts on here, now I know it isn't just me.  Anyone that can post some withdrawal schedule information, I would really appreciate it.  My Dr. wanted me to go from 90mg. daily to 60mg daily for one week, then one 60mg every other day for one week then stop.  Glad I didn't do it that way, went back and got some 30mg samples to wean off at slower rate.
4139$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$4/1/2008 11:35:01 AM$Reviewer: AirGal, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$Day One - major nausea, unable to perform my job.
4140$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$4/1/2008 5:05:00 AM$Reviewer: Rosie, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $1$1$4$Initially felt ok.  Then started feeling tired.  Fatigue increased.  Felt bad all the time.  Did not want to do anything.  Knew I had to do something to feel better.  Cymbalta was the only new medication so I decided to stop taking it.  Side effects included dizziness, insomnia, mental fog. I felt like I was loosing it at times. It took about 8 weeks of decreasing the dosage   (60 mg to 30 mg) from daily to every other day, every two days, etc. before I was able to stop.  I am now free and feel like a new person.  Never again will I take cymbalta nor can I recommend it to others.  I felt like a drug addict coming down from a drug.  It was horrible.
4141$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$3/31/2008 8:15:16 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$5$
4142$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$3/31/2008 7:08:27 PM$Reviewer: badmoonrison, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver) $5$5$5$I have had depresion and anxeity issues since my husband of 25 yrs was diagnosed with 4th stage throat cancer in october.He has gone thru radical chemo & radiation,plus surgery,and is now healing and cancer free they say,however during all that i was the caretaker and when it was all over ,realized I was going thru some very serious depression,cause i was flat out scared to death!I have been on cymbalta for about 2 weeks,and noticed a difference the first day!!I feel great,finally some energy,ambition to get out of the house,no more aches and pains,and no side affects at all so far!I think this drug works differently for everyone,and lovley for me!!!

column1: 4147$Condition: Repeated Episodes of Anxiety$3/29/2008 10:22:41 AM$Reviewer: exhaustedmomma07
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$5$5$"Started on celexa over 6 months ago- I have 7 children
column3: an ex-husband who is ever so ""pleasant"" to deal with and I am a R.N. who works 16 hour shifts on weekends so children aren't in daycare-WOW!! No stress there!!!Point being- Celexa just made me feel WIPED!!! If I didn't Have to breathe I probably wouldn't have- I was that drained- so I went into my Dr. and told him NO MORE!!! help me with something that isn't going to send me into a depressive cycle- I already have GAD I didn't need to add anything else to my list of stressors!! So he put me on Cymbalta 30mg first week and then I am to adjust to 60mg starting week 2 and maintain there. I am only on day 4 of the 30mg and I feel much better- I also have been making sure I am taking a multivitamin regular with an added extra Iron pill ( as I have battled Anemia off and on since childhood)- so far the only ""side effect"" I've noticed is I'm not really hungry or interested in food anymore(which is also truely a god send- hince the term ""STRESS EATER"")so I've read all 641 responses so far and thought I'd add mine- I'll come back in a month and re-post and see if anythings changed- but so far so good!!!"

column1: 4150$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$3/28/2008 12:56:27 AM$Reviewer: Penguin-Lover
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$2$4$I was on Cymbalta for about a year and the best thing about it was it gave me some relief from chronic back pain. I didn't like the side affects - weird flushes and complete zapping of sexual drive. If a dose is missed the flushes are disturbing. I also have very weak nails and was wearing silk wraps on them when I started taking Cymbalta. After about a month the silk wraps wouldn't stay on so I went to acrylic. I ended up having to take them off. After I quit taking Cymbalta I had the wraps put back on and all was well until I tried to take it again. I haven't heard of anyone else having this side effect. It was very difficult to get off if it.

column1: 4151$Condition: Other$3/27/2008 3:43:13 PM$Reviewer: Shelly
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I was prescribed Cymbalta for fibromyalgia.  I do have anxiety
column3: but not depression.  My rheumatologist started me on 30 mg for 3 weeks and then increased it to 60 mg.  During the first month
column4: I did have some very strange side effects
column5: but they eventually went away.  I have been on it for over a year.  I still have problems with sweating sometimes.  Soon after starting on it
column6: I decided that there was nothing wrong with me and I took myself off of it.  It was obvious right away that I could not do without it!  I didn't have any withdrawals because I weened myself off of it slowly.  I was in so much pain that I couldn't get out of bed and had to cancel all my plans.  I will never do without it again!  I was able to do without my other pain medicines like Ultram
column7: Vicodin
column8: and Tylenol #3 with Codiene.  I am very happy with it and plan on sticking with it.  I work at a very high stress job and seem to only have trouble when I have several high stress / bad days in a row or when I try to do too much physically.

column1: 4157$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$3/26/2008 3:19:55 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$1$1$I recommend that before you start this med that you ask your doctor for a blood test. I took the med and felt great
column2: took away neck and back pain immedietly. Then 4 weeks into it I felt hungry all the time and even after I ate a huge meal I would feel hungry. I stayed on the med for 5 months then just quit taking it because of the hunger and weight gain
column3: despite exercising an hour 5 days a week. The withdrawl was hell
column4: but what i didn't realize is that if you have blood sugar problems like I have (hypoglycemia) this med aggravated it and that is why I was hungry all the time and never felt full. Be sure to check thyroid first too because thyroid and depression symtoms are the same as was my case
column5: but didn't find that out until after going through the expense of the med and hell of the withdrawl.

column1: 4181$Condition: Other$3/18/2008 2:46:19 PM$Reviewer: Hurting
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$5$I am 35 and have suffered with migraines 20+ years. They have gotten extermely bad and my doctor suggested trying Cymbalta. I have never experienced such bad side effects from any drug. It started with nausea and vomiting. Nausea was constant. I couldn't sleep at night even after trying to switch the time I took Cymbalta. Over the counter sleep aids had no effect. I was now missing more work then I did with the migraines which are still there. The diarrhea is horrible and uncontrolable at times. I called my doctor and he said to just stop taking it. I'm four days into being Cymbalta free and I have never felt worse in my life. I can't begin to explain the exhaustion I am feeling. I spent the majority of the weekend
column3: my scheduled day off
column4: and had to leave work again today because I am so sick. I was in the bathroom since 5:30 in the morning getting throwing up. I don't know how much of this I can take anymore. I did research side effects before I started the drug. Didn't find a lot of information. I certainly didn't find any information on the withdrawal until I started to read reviews here. I do at least feel better after reading other reviews. Thought I was going crazy and that I was the only one struggling with this one. If you are thinking about taking this drug
column5: don't do it. I totally regret ever trying this medicine and I just hope I can make it through the rest of the withdrawls.

I have biploar disorder and I use this with Lamictal. It is important that if you have bipolar or to use a mood stabilizer along with an antidepressant. Do not use an anti-depressant alone as this can cause a manic episode and/or deeper depression. Also
column3: do not get this drug from a PCP
column4: you must be evaluated by a Psychiatrist. General Practitioners do not know enough about this type of medicine. I experienced two years of hell trying to control mania and depression
column5: as I was misdiagnosed by my doctor. Psychiatrists are the only one's truly qualified to diagnose the type of depression you have as there is many differnt variations and contributing factors. Wrong dosages and a misdiagnosis can send you into a nightmare and can actually make it worse and cause long term negative effects on your mental health.

column1: 4214$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$3/2/2008 3:22:04 PM$Reviewer: Veronica
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$1$1$"Although the cymbalta did treat my depression to the point that I could function once again
column3: I do have a couple of major complaints. There was not nearly enough information provided to me regarding

column1: side effects. I am someone who actually reads the pamphlet that the pharmacist gives you.  No where to be found are the severe impact it can have on your weight. Over time
column2: and I have been on it approximately 18 months.  Upon further investigation on my part
column3: I have found that cymbalta actually enters your fat cells and STAYS THERE! OVER TIME the weight creeps on and on.  To top that off are the severe side effects when you are trying to ween yourself off of it.  For example
column4: I have  gained 15 POUNDS in the two weeks while trying to eliminate cymbalta from my life. Not to mention the other awful side effects: brain zaps
column5: mood swings
column6: high blood pressure
column7: urge to urinate one second & not making it to the bathroom the next
column8: diahrea
column9: joint pain
column10: brain fog
column11: adema
column12: slurred speech and others. Think twice before using this drug. In the 18 months that I have been taking it I have gained 34 pounds. On a 5'1"" frame thats another whole person practically. I was in a size 6-8 petite
column13: and now I am busting out size 16's.

column1: Talk about a reason to be depressed!!! It's been 17 days and the brain zaps are almost gone and I am ""starting"" to feel like myself again-except for the weight gain. If I was eating carbs
column2: sweets
column3: etc. that would be one thing. But I follow a high protein
column4: high vegetable diet.  Really consider the consequences."

Anxiety. Went on for four hours.  Was able to finally fall asleep for 4 hours, woke in a haze, extremity pains were gone. column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $3$1$1$"I was placed on this medication for neuropathy and major depression ..was taking it for 2 years on 60 mg and a few months after was placed on 120mg more times than I remember..each doctor saying I was on too much or too little but in my heart of hearts I do not beleive any of them knew really.

column1: give in. Please read every ones words
column2: find strength in them as I have because I will tell you one thing for sure your Doctor does not have the answers! Do not give up ! Get off Cymbalta and never ever look back.  "

I am not the only one going through this. The withdrawal symptoms are so severe I keep giving in and finally taking it again just to feel some relief. This time I am not going back. I want this horrible drug out of my system. When I was on it I couldn't sleep. I tried ambien and lunesta, and they didn't work. The withdawal symptoms include horrible physical pain and weakness, intense periods of depression and crying. Feeling like you are lost. If anyone has ever seen a Cymbalta commercial, thats exactly what you will feel like when you try to wean yourself off of it. I hope this can be helpful to anyone.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Prescribed for not only anxiety and depression but also severe migraines.  My P.A. had seen some use of cymbalta in a colleague's chronic pain facility for migraines.  This has worked WONDERS!  I can get out of bed and going to work is a lot easier with the reduction in depressive symptoms.  My anxiety has decreased greatly as well.  I was at the point of have at least a panic attack a month...since I've started I've only had 2 in 14 months! I had previously had migraines that would last for days at a time at least 1-2 times a month.  I would be completely incapacitated when these struck; dark
column3: quiet
column4: and cool was the only thing I could handle.  Sounds
column5: light and smells would all result in severe nausea.  Since I've started Cymbalta I've only had 2 real migraines.  Everything else has been controled w/ otc pain relievers!  Cymbalta has been a Godsend for me.  I did experience some dry mouth and stomach upset the first few weeks.  I also have sleepless nights that are normally remedied with some otc sleep meds or benedryl.  I have heard some horror stories of coming off
column6: including from my pharmacist but I don't plan on changing anything any time soon.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$4$4$I was diagnosed with major depression several years ago and was on just about every antidepressant out there over the years. I tried Elavil
column3: trazadone

column8: lexapro

column11: which made the manic phase worse. My symptoms of rapid cycling lasted for about 6 weeks
column12: which can be exhausting when it's over. The ride back down is ten times worse than the depression I had been dealing with over the last few years.  I had only had an episode of mania once before this
column13: so with this second episode
column14: I was diagnosed with bipolar disorder. I used the websites tools to track my moods and meds. It is a very helpful tool to use to communicate with the doctor. This was the first medication that I used that helped my depression
column15: but be careful. If you are bipolar and don't know it

column18: give it at least 3 weeks before deciding it is not working.

column8: so I have learned to be patient. I have lived with chronic pain for the last 18 years now

But NEVER totally get off of it if you have been at a high dosage for a year or more
column2: I thought the world was coming to an end
column3: crying etc.  Then I took a 75mg from my Psy and in a couple hours I was ok.  The Cymbalta I started 8 months ago was a 60mg pill by my family Dr. replacing the 150mg Effexor XR (Burn out or tolerance) and the change over was no problem and it did benefit I think
column4: it's hard to tell.  So...I wnet to a Psychiatrist and he doubled the Cymbalta to 120 mg.  That seemed to do the trick!  He mentioned the 60mg max was not helping his patients so he conferred with other Psych's and they said their patients did well with taking 2 of the 60mg Cymbalta's.  In addition
column5: I take Clonazepam 1mg after work and 2 mg at night for teeth grinding.  If I son't have it at night I WON'T sleep.  So be careful.  It's like Xanax but last longer and the effect comes on much slower than Xanax.  Good Luck with your depression.  Remember
column6: it's a brain chemical imbalance
column7: NOT YOU!  I got it from my father's side of the family.  He's depressed all the time and won't take anything just like his father and his father's father committed suicide.  So...it's not a weakness
column8: it's a disease.  Remember that!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have always been depressed but have been able to manage it somewhat.  Katrina and her devastation both to us
column3: our family and friends pushed me into a deep abyss.  For months I could not get out of bed
column4: cried constantly
column5: didn't bathe
column6: didn't care.  My Dr. tried several meds before the Cymbalta.  The first major step was that it got me out of bed.  Then the constant crying started to subside.  I slowly started coming out of the fog.  Even the symptoms I had shown before ""K"" were easing. I did not feel high or euphoric or out of control
column7: but I did not feel hopeless or numb inside either.  I began to feel like a real person again.  I have been on this medication for over two years now and I guess I will be on it for the rest of my life.  I have had no negative effects to speak of.  I still cry once in a while if something upsets me
column8: like normal people do
column9: but I feel so much more in control of myself
column10: not out of control emotionally.  It has literally pulled me out of the doldrums and I am very pleased with it.  "

I had a lot of family issues over the past week and completely spaced taking it. I started getting tired all the time
column4: to the point that I was falling asleep at work and while driving
column5: I was nauseous and dizzy
column6: and had no energy. Yesterday I had enough of it and that was when I realized it had been 5 days since I took it last. I took my 60mg prescription last night and felt a million times better this morning. I like that I can feel it working
column7: but I am worried about how hard it will be to quit if I ever need to.

column1: 4683$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$10/25/2007 12:21:20 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $2$1$1$"After bouncing through many types of anti-depressants to get one that worked

I'm disgruntled and say it's hard to use because of the stupid way they've got me set up on it.  I'm at 180mg a day: 120 in the morning and 60 at night.  It would have been much easier to give me a huge bottle of 60mg'ers and take 2 in the morning... but
column3: NO.  So now
column4: for bacially one prescribed drug I have two separate prescriptions: 120mg and 60mg: paying twice for what I should only have to pay once.  Ripoff!

column1: At this point I'd rather go back to my old AD
column2: Celexa.  No
column3: that didn't work either (obvious due the change to Cymbalta) but at least I didn't have the dosage/prescription hassle.

column1: It may
column2: or may not
column3: have also contributed to a definitive spike in my anxiety
column4: psychosis
column5: and paranoia.  As the Cymbalta increased

column1: Many times I feel like I'd rather just not have any at all.  Sure
column2: nothing would be better but at this point I wouldn't be any worse off.  And at the very least I'd not be paying for overpriced medication that hasn't done anything more than a glass of water can do!"

column3: I had a hard time even getting out of bed and cried every day--especially at night. It's been about 5 weeks since starting the medication and I feel great and want to be with people in public places now. As before
column4: I didn't want to speak to anyone--not even my family. So
column5: I have a smile on my face now. I have to admit
column6: I noticed the problem when I was crying for no reason and becoming angry a while back. So
column7: I went to my family physician and he recommended the drug---much thanks to him and even myself for even taking a step into the doctor's office in the first place. Who knows where I would be. Thank you Cymbalta! I am even more focused and happier at work. Everyone around me has noticed the change in me in a positive way.

column1: 4743$Condition: Other$9/30/2007 9:47:22 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$4$5$I was recently placed on Cymbalta to treat my symptoms of pain and fatigue related to Severe Fibromyalgia Syndrom. I experienced  Extreme side effects first three days as well as first 3 days of increasing dosage. Experience Several sidethat can be bothersome
column2: like increased sweating ( I never use to sweat-even for the 15 years i lived in Arizona) dry mouth
column3: difficutlty urinating
column4: increased heart beat
column5: drop in blood pressure upon standing
column6: However my flares do not last as long and after living with daily pain and exxhaustion since 1985
column7: (Diagnosed 2007) It has changed the quality of my life.  I would encourge the FDA to approve for the treatment of Fibromyalgia to help other suffers like myself win back a better quality of life.

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years$3$3$5$Cymbalta has been fairly well effective at alleviating my suicidal feelings. It has been even more effective at relieving my back pain. (The back pain is either Arthritis or degenerative disc disease)  However

column4: has no solution.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$5$I'm a 30 year old female and started with 30 mg. The pain from arthritus
column3: bone spur in my heel
column4: and constant jaw pain was releived within first 3 days of beginning Cymbalta.  Some loss of appetite.  Major help with anger and mood swings.  Can think clearly now.   Mind isn't racing like it was. No trouble sleeping
column5: nausea
column6: no bad side effects.  Have been on 30 mg for 6 weeks.  Requesting to move up to 40mg if possible because pain relief has subsided with continued use.  Love this medicine.  Best thing I have ever taken.  Recommended it to several family members with depression or pain.

column1: 4764$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$9/24/2007 7:44:29 PM$Reviewer: $5$4$5$i have gone back on it a couple of times for my depression.  it makes me feel almost manic
column2: but i'm trying a lower dose this time.  it has worked well besides that one side effect.  i would recommend it to people who are easily sensitive to medications and can have easy allergic reactions like me.  i have not had a reaction severe enough to stop it.  i also recommend it to people who have found other meds to be ineffective.  this has been the only med that has helped my depression.
